vdma_ssl_agv_key_filestringThe name of the key file to be used by the AGV. Used only when vdma_ssl_mode set to 2.
vdma_ssl_pem_passwordstringThe password that is used to unlock key file. Used only when vdma_ssl_mode set to 2.
vdma_ssl_ca_filestringThe PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates for verification. Used only when vdma_ssl_mode set to 2.
vdma_ssl_cipher_liststringThe cipher list for SSL. Used only when vdma_ssl_mode set to 2.
vdma_ssl_versionint2The TLS/SSL version to use. 0 = TLS v1, 1 = TLS v1.1, 2 = TLS v1.2
vdma_ssl_verify_hostnameint1Enables verification of the server hostname. 0 = Do not verify, 1 = Verify
vdma_area_name_overridestringOverride the area name from map
vdma_versionint2VDMA version - 0 = v1.01.2, 1 = v1.1, 2 = v.2.0.
vdma_drive_order_typeint2VDMA drive order type - 0 = JSON mapped segment (v.1.01.2), 1 = Segment based driveOrder (v1.1 and v2.0), 2 = Trajectory based (v1.1 and v2.0).
vdma_actions_check_spint1Should vdma actions require compatible symbolic point.
vdma_actions_sp_close_distfloat0.3How close [m] a symbolic point needs to be to be accepted.
vdma_loadunload_check_load_stateint1Should vdma load&unload actions check the AGV load state.
vdma_default_drive_speed_m_p_sfloat2.0Default speed for VDMA trajectories when speed is not limited.
vdma_traj_pt_dist_mfloat0.1Desired distance between trajectory points when interpolating VDA trajectories.
vdma_traj_min_radius_mfloat0.5Turning radius for the VDA trajectory interpolation.
vdma_debug_topic_enabledint0Enable sending of extra debug info to MQTT broker.
vdma_traj_interpolation_typeint20 = Trajectory interpolation disabled, 1 = Dubins curve interpolation, 2 - Linear interpolation (default)
vdma_treat_all_loads_as_racksint0Make the VDA5050 interface treat all loads & unloads as if they were racks.
vdma_trivially_reach_multiple_nodesint1Make the VDA5050 interface treat multiple nodes in the beginning of the order as trivially reachable.
vdma_use_symbolic_points_for_actionsint0Use virtual symbolic points to implement actions. Currently only used for racking
vdma_pivot_generation_angle_degfloat30.0Automatically generate pivots if there are sharper corners in the route than this
vdma_rotation_on_edge_margin_pointsint2When rotating on an edge, reach the target orientation this many (linear interpolation) points before the end of the edge. Increase if the AGV doesn't reach the target orientation in time.
vdma_reverse_tolerance_degfloat90.0Tolerance for reversing on an edge, in degrees. AGV will reverse when edge has tangential orientation that deviates from PI at most by this margin
vdma_clear_order_when_losing_positionint1Make the VDA5050 interface clear the order if position is not initialized.
vdma_escalate_errors_to_fatal_timeout_sfloat0.0Timeout for escalating errors to fatal. Navitrol errors are initially reported as 'warnings' and changed to 'fatal' after this time. 0 = disabled (immediately fatal).
vdma_error_reporting_policyint0Error reporting policy for VDMA interface. 0 = report only active navitrol errors and drive rejections, 1 = keep errors that happen during drive order active

Trajectory and curvature related

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
curvature_limits_angle_error_degfloat0.0Additional margin for error checking when checking steer limits.E.g.ifsteerlimitis50degreesanderroris5degrees,AGVcandrivecurvaturethatrequires55degreesofsteering.
traj_ref_dec_reductionfloat1.0Deceleration reduction in route speed reference calculation to leave control margin during driving.
traj_tight_curve_turning_radius_limitfloat0.1Defines maximum limit for trajectory's turning radius [m] for which the trajectory is considered to be a tight curve.
curv_pos_corrfloat1.0Coeeficient for correcting positive curvature references.
curv_neg_corrfloat1.0Coefficient for correcting negative curvature references.
custom_route_start_node_min_dist_mfloat0.3Minimum distance for the second node from the start.
custom_route_start_node_max_dist_mfloat1.0Maximum distance for the second node from the start.
custom_route_start_node_dist_ratiofloat0.25Fraction value of percentage from the vector length that is used to calculate node location. For example, if vector length is 2.0m and the percentage is 25.0%, the second node is place 0.5m from the start. After this percentage the minimum and maximum limits are checked.
custom_route_end_node_min_dist_mfloat0.3Minimum distance for the second last node before target.
custom_route_end_node_max_dist_mfloat1.0Maximum distance for the second last node before target.
custom_route_end_node_dist_ratiofloat0.5Fraction value of percentage from the vector length that is used to calculate node location. For example if vector length is 2.0m and the ratio is 50.0%, the secon dlast node is place 1.0m from the target. After this percentage, the minimum and maximum limits are checked.
custom_route_max_support_node_angle_degfloat90.0Maximum angle for support node on both start and end [deg].
custom_route_min_support_node_angle_degfloat0.0Minimum angle for support node on both start and end [deg].

Barrier stop

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
barrier_stop_check_distfloat0.0Barrier stop signals are only checked withing this distance [m] of symbolic point that has Barrier stop tag. 0 = barrier stop disabled.
barrier_stop_signal_max_wait_time_msint2000Maximum wait time from first wheel stop signal to another before error is set and barrier stop aborted.

Kinematics

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
sub_diff_wheel_trackfloat0.10Distance between the centers of the wheels in differential steer-drive wheel unit.
coupled_axle_steer_coupling_ratiofloat2.0Ratio between front steering wheel angle to rear axle steering e.g. value 2.0 indicates front steering wheel turns twice as much as rear axle.
coupled_axle_steer_nav_pt_distfloat0.2Distance of navigation point from rear axle towards front of coupled axle steer AGV.
sub_diff_max_turn_wheel_speedfloat0.5Maximum diffunit turning speed [m/s] for each wheel.
omni_steer_nbrint0Number of controlled steering wheels
omni_steer_ang_offset_degfloat[]0.0Offset added to sensor angle value to give zero angle when the wheel is straight forwards.
omni_can_enc_steer_node_idint[]0CAN node ID of the angle encoder on each wheel: 0 = not defined, 1-127 = valid node ID.
omni_steer_enc_pulses_overflow_arruint[]0xFFFFFFFUMaximum pulse value of the steering encoder of each wheel.
omni_steer_enc_pulses_per_rev_arruint[]1000Pulse count corresponding to one revolution of the steering encoder on each wheel.
omni_steer_enc_zero_arruint[]0Pulse encoder value corresponding to zero angle of wheel.
omni_steer_limit_enableint[]0Enables the steer limit for each omni wheel seperately.
omni_steer_limit_CCW_angle_degfloat[]179.9Steer angle limit measured from wheel's zero angle in CCW direction. Maximum value 179,9 deg. This parameter must be enabled by corresponding omni_steer_limit_enable.
omni_steer_limit_CW_angle_degfloat[]179.9Steer angle limit measured from wheel's zero angle in CW direction. Maximum value 179,9 deg. This parameter must be enabled by corresponding omni_steer_limit_enable.
omni_steer_limit_angle_tolerance_degfloat20.0Determines the tolerance from the minimum and maximum steer limits, where an automatic wheel swapping is initiated by changing the angle reference by 180 degrees.
omni_steer_limit_max_reference_diff_degfloat1.0Determines the difference to the minimum and maximum steer limits where the reference is limit. Range 0-90 degrees. Example: limit 180, value 1, maximum reference is 179.
omni_steer_limit_swap_turn_tolerance_degfloat2.0Determines how close to the target angle the wheel must be turned before swapping is considered done. Range 0.1-90 derees.
omni_steer_limit_hard_stop_buffer_degfloat5.0Determines the margin of the measured wheel angle to the minimum and maximum steer limits for activating a hard stop.
omni_steer_limit_active_control_before_stopping_buffer_degfloat3.0Margin of the measured wheel angle from the minimum and maximum steer limits for actively repelling te steer reference while vehicle is moving.
omni_steer_limit_adjust_additional_wheels_buffer_degfloat20.0When one wheel has reached the limit. This value will be added to 'angle_tolerance_deg' to check if multiple wheels should be adjusted simultaneously.
omni_steer_limit_soft_slow_buffer_degfloat10.0This value will be added to 'angle_tolerance_deg' to slow down when nearing the limit. Does not activate wheel adjusting.
omni_steer_limit_max_control_difference_degfloat30.0Determines the maximum difference between reference and measured angle during wheel swapping.
omni_deadrec_ref_axleint[]0Only two wheels (preferably not collinear) should be selected for deadreckoning. Set 1 for selecting. Indexes according to customer wheel numbering.
maintain_omni_kinematicsint0Set to 1 if all wheel axes shall intersect in the turning point defined by the radius and steer vector references at all times (no divergence from kinematic solution, causes excessive wheel turning).
omni_parallel_wheels_check_enabledint00 = always use parameter defined wheels for dead reckoning, 1 to change dead reackoning wheels if defined wheels are parallel, 2 to use always the wheels with biggest angle difference.
omni_parallel_wheels_check_angle_diff_degfloat1.0Angle difference between wheels considering them parallel enough to temporarily select other wheels for dead reckoning if selection is activated.
omni_deadreck_calc_parallel_wheels_angle_deadband_degfloat2.0Angle difference between wheels for considering them parallel and calculating vehicle turning based on speed differential instead of turning point in the intersection of their axes.
omni_steer_ang_err_speed_limit_enabledint0Functionality limits driving speed if steering angle error is too high.
omni_steer_ang_err_speed_limit_gainfloat0.001How fast the speed is limited if steering cannot follow reference. Value 0.00001 limits the speed very slowly, value 1 limits instantly to lowest speed.
omni_steer_ang_err_speed_limit_timer_msint1500How long the speed limitation will be enabled after steering follows references again. Works also as a time hysteresis for the angle error monitoring.
kinematic_free_limited_drivingint0AGV with kinematic free interface has driving limitations: 0 = None, 1 = Speed vector restricted to longitudinal only (nonholonomic)
omni_joystick_sector_limit_1_degfloat0.0Lower limit on the possible web UI joystick directions in parallel drive. From 0 (up) counter clockwise to 360.
omni_joystick_sector_limit_2_degfloat0.0Upper limit on the possible web UI joystick directions in parallel drive. From 0 (up) counter clockwise to 360.
omni_joystick_deadbandfloat0.0Joystick deadband for parallel driving. Movements smaller than this are ignored. 0 is no deadband, 1 is the full movement range of the joystick.

Load handling

Actuator and load handling

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
speed_set_while_loadedint0Used to select the speed set that is used when the AGV has a load aboard. For example, value 1 activates speed settings defined in array index 0.
actuator_typeint0Type of the actuator: 0 = disabled, 1 = no control commands (data visualized), 2 = reference value controlled actuator, 3 = IO-controlled actuator (low/high position only)
actuator_simulateint1Simulate actuator in simulation mode.
actuator_inner_tolerance_mmint-1Actuator is being controlled until measured value is inside tolerance. -1 = inner tolerance is disabled
actuator_inner_tolerance_timer_msint0Time [ms] that measured value has to be inside inner tolerance value until actuator control is stopped.
actuator_outer_tolerance_mmint0Actuator control is started when measured value differs more than tolerance from target value.
actuator_tolerance_reach_mmint0Tolerance for the reach. Reach of the fork is controlled until the measured value is inside the tolerance from the target value.
actuator_tolerance_tilt_degfloat0.0Tolerance for the tilt. Tilt of the fork is controlled until the measured value is inside the tolerance from the target value.
actuator_tolerance_side_mmint0Tolerance for side shift. Side shift of the fork is controlled until the measured value is inside the tolerance from the target value.
actuator_tolerance_scanner_lift_mmint2Tolerance for scanner lift. Actuator is being controlled until measured value is inside tolerance.
actuator_min_valint0Minimum value of the actuator.
actuator_load_min_valint200Minimum value of the actuator when AGV is loaded.
actuator_max_valint800Maximum value of the actuator.
actuator_home_val_mmint0Normal actuator height while driving without a load.
actuator_load_aboard_offset_mmint0Offset to the reference actuator value when AGV is loading / carrying a load.
actuator_timer_sint20Timer [s] for detecting that measured actuator value reaches target value in time. Triggers an error.
actuator_only_on_spint0Allow loading/unloading only on Pick-Up/Drop-Off symbolic point.
actuator_max_dist_err_from_spfloat0.0Maximum distance error from Pick-Up/Drop-Off symbolic point when starting loading/unloading. Only used if actuator_only_on_sp is enabled and parameter value > 0.
actuator_allow_activation_modeint1Actuator activation mode: 0 = actuator control allowed only in load state, 1 = actuator control allowed in auto & load state, 2 = enable protection zone override in standby&auto
actuator_trust_io_load_statusint0Mode for determining load status: 0 = Load status from load detection sensor. If no sensor, load status determined from Load/Unload actions, 1 = Load status from high/low limit, 2 = Load status determined comparing measured value to minimum load value (actuator_load_min_val).
actuator_val_ioint-1Actuator value to fleet control. Overrides one physical Integer input value, -1 = disabled.
actuator_load_det_ioint-1If load sensor is used or parameter actuator_trust_io_load_status activated, sends the load status to the fleet control as a Physical Binary Input, -1 = disabled.
actuator_load_det_io_typeint0Define what load status type is sent to fleet control via binary input. 0 = load sensor raw data, 1 = AGV load status
actuator_load_status_ioint-1Load status to fleet control as a Physical Binary Input, -1 = disabled
actuator_reach_enabledint0Enable actuator with reach functionality (e.g. reach truck).
actuator_reach_home_valint0Value of the reach actuator when at home position.
actuator_reach_load_valint0Value of the reach actuator when moved to loading position
actuator_reach_unload_valint0Value of the reach actuator when moved to unloading position.
actuator_tilt_enabledint0Enable actuator with tilt functionality (e.g. forklift).
actuator_tilt_home_val_degfloat0.0Value of the tilt actuator when at home position.
actuator_tilt_dn_val_degfloat0.0Value of the tilt actuator when at down position.
actuator_tilt_up_val_degfloat0.0Value of the tilt actuator when at upper position.
actuator_side_shift_enabledint0Enable actuator with side shift functionality.
actuator_side_shift_home_valint0Value of the side shift actuator when at home position.
actuator_side_shift_left_valint0Value of the side shift actuator when at left position.
actuator_side_shift_right_valint0Value of the side shift actuator when at right position.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_enabledint0Enable actuator with auxiliary lift.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_typeint21 = manual control, 2 = reference value controlled actuator, 3 = binary controlled actuator (low/high pos only)
actuator_auxiliary_lift_tolerance_mmint0Auxiliary lift tolerance.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_min_val_mmint0Auxiliary lift minimum value.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_max_val_mmint3000Auxiliary lift maximum value.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_load_val_mmint100Auxiliary lift loaded value.
actuator_auxiliary_lift_as_secondary_lifting_deviceint0Auxiliary lift is used as secondary lifting device meaning that both main lift and secondary lift can have load separately.
actuator_rotate_enabledint0Actuator with rotate feature.
actuator_rotate_tolerance_degfloat1.0Rotate tolerance [deg].
actuator_rotate_min_val_degfloat0.0Rotate min value [deg].
actuator_rotate_max_val_degfloat180.0Rotate max value [deg].
actuator_rotate_middle_val_degfloat0.0Rotate middle value [deg]. Relative to the AGV frame.
actuator_rotate_right_val_degfloat0.0Rotate right value [deg]. Relative to the AGV frame.
actuator_rotate_left_val_degfloat0.0Rotate left value [deg]. Relative to the AGV frame.
actuator_filter_single_zerosint0Enables filtering a single zero from actuator measurements.
actuator_keep_height_after_dropoff_aborted_distance_mfloat2.0Distance from aborted dropoff location in meters to keep the actuator at current height.
actuator_periodic_status_update_interval_msint0Time interval [ms] for sending actuator status to fleet control. 0 = Periodic update disabled.
actuator_scanner_lift_enabledint0Enables scanner lift that is attached to fork.
actuator_scanner_lift_typeint21 = manual control, 2 = reference value controlled actuator, 3 = binary controlled actuator (low/high pos only)
actuator_scanner_lift_home_val_mmint0Home value for scanner. Should be safe with any fork height and a bit above the fork level if used for load detection.
actuator_scanner_lift_detection_level_val_mmint-150Scanner height value in which the scanner can see past a loaded resource.
actuator_scanner_lift_min_safe_val_mmint100Minimum scanner height from the fork's zero level.
actuator_scanner_lift_used_for_load_detint0Defines if scanner in lift is used for load detection.
actuator_lower_scanner_before_unload_buffer_distfloat0.6Distance [m] from unload buffer when scanner is lowered.
actuator_frame_longitudinal_tilt_tolerance_degfloat1.0Frame longitudinal tilt tolerance [deg]. The actuator is controlled until measured value is within this tolerance from the reference value.
actuator_frame_longitudinal_tilt_home_val_degfloat0.0Value [deg] of the tilt actuator when at home position.
actuator_frame_longitudinal_tilt_automatic_activationint0Defines if the longitudinal tilt actuator is automatically activated when driving. 0 = Default actuator activation. 1 = In addition actuator is activated always when in auto or manual state.
actuator_frame_longitudinal_tilt_automatic_activation_acc_limitfloat0.0Frame longitudinal tilt balancing is only active, if AGV:s navigation point acceleration or deceleration is smaller than this limit. 0 = unlimited
actuator_eth_ctrl_scaleint10Scale how fast reference value for actuator (e.g. lift height) changes when using remote control section via Supervisor interface.
actuator_load_sequenceint[]0Loading sequence: 0=none, 1=load, 2=unload, 3=reachFw, 4=reachHome, 5=tiltDn, 6=tiltHome, 7=tiltUp, 8=sideLeft, 9=sideHome, 10=sideRight, 11=notUsed, 12=auxLiftUp, 13=auxLiftDown
actuator_unload_sequenceint[]0Unloading sequence: 0=none, 1=load, 2=unload, 3=reachFw, 4=reachHome, 5=tiltDn, 6=tiltHome, 7=tiltUp, 8=sideLeft, 9=sideHome, 10=sideRight, 11=notUsed, 12=auxLiftUp, 13=auxLiftDown
actuator_disable_load_sensor_distancefloat0.8Within the distance from loading/unloading point, load detection sensor is not used when driving
actuator_check_load_sensor_status_before_loadingint01 = check that load sensor detecs a load, before loading.
actuator_check_load_sensor_status_after_loadingint11 = check that load sensor detects a load, after loading.
actuator_check_load_sensor_status_after_unloadingint01 = check that load sensor shows empty, after unloading.
actuator_move_allowed_while_driving_loadedint1Allow moving the actuator while AGV is driving and carrying a load.
actuator_move_allowed_while_driving_not_loadedint1Allow moving the actuator while AGV is driving and not carrying a load.
actuator_not_in_home_position_limit_agv_speedint0Limit AGV speed if actuator is not in home position: 0 = Speed not limited, 1 = Speed limited
actuator_not_in_home_position_agv_speed_loaded_m_per_sfloat1.0AGV speed [m/s] when actuator is not in home position and actuator is loaded.
actuator_not_in_home_position_agv_speed_unloaded_m_per_sfloat1.0AGV speed [m/s] when actuator is not in home position and actuator is not loaded.
actuator_input_source_arrint[]0Defines from which source actuator input is read: 0 = System selects, 1 = CAN Actuator/Encoder, 2 = Supervisor status section, 3 = Supervisor msg 1031, 4 = ROS, 10 = Custom CAN, 11 = Custom Modbus, 12 = Custom Supervisor
actuator_input_type_arrint[]0Defines the actuator input source for specific actuator type: 0 = All types, 1 = Lift, 2 = Secondary Lift, 3 = Reach, 4 = Tilt up/down, 5 = Turn fork, 6 = Side shift, 7 = Sensor lift
actuator_number_of_binary_outputsint0Number of generic binary outputs on the AGV
actuator_home_pos_safety_margin_metersfloat0.5Safe area around AGV to keep the actuator at the home position.
actuator_strict_for_home_pos_zoneint1AGV is commanded to stop while controlling the actuator to the home position.
actuator_safety_zone_margin_metersfloat0.5Safe area around AGV to prevent moving actuator near racks.
change_load_status_only_on_load_stateint00 = Load status can be changed in every state based on load sensor, 1 = Load status can be changed only in Load state based on load sensor, 2 = Same as mode 1 but load status can change also to empty when both Fleet control and load sensor signal so and current load status is full.
min_distance_to_check_the_load_sensorfloat0.3Minimum distance to check the load sensor. Used to avoid false checks if sensor gives bad data. The check starts at actuator_disable_load_sensor_distance. If set to -1.0, check is not used.
load_sensor_conflict_goes_to_manualint00 = Load sensor conflict raises error. 1 = Conflict changes the state to Manual. load_sensor_conflict_manual_reset_source parameter tells the source to release the Manual state after the load sensor is okay.
load_sensor_conflict_manual_reset_sourceint10 = none, 1 = Manual state is released from supervisor, 2 = Manual state is released using touchscreen UI
load_sensor_conflict_modeint20 = disable, 1 = Trigger error if sensor does not match with the Navithor load status. Check is done at actuator_disable_load_sensor_distance from symbolic point, at the beginning of the buffer lanes and when state is changed from Manual. 2 = Trigger error if sensor does not match with the Navithor load status in Auto state.
load_sensor_status_change_timer_msint2000Error is set if load sensor status changes in Auto state and stays in new value for this amount of time [ms].
disable_safetyint0Disables safety message is send to supervisor.
actuator_disable_safety_max_value_mmint0Disable safety request is set if actuator is lower than this value. 0 = not used
disable_safety_distance_to_load_or_unloadfloat-1.0Disable safety request is set if driving closer than this distance to load or unload. 0 = not used
disable_safety_distance_on_bufferfloat-1.0Disable safety if driving closer than this distance to target in load or unload buffer. 0 = not used.
disable_safety_limit_speedfloat0.2Limit speed when safety is disabled, if disable_safety_distance_to_load_or_unload > 0. If it is below 0, speed is not limited.
normal_unload_or_load_slow_down_distancefloat-1.0Distancetostartslowdownbeforeload or unloadsymbolicpoint[m].Usesthedisable_safety_limit_speed.0 = Not used. Alsonotusedifdockingandpalletdetectionareusedinloadpoint.
actuator_ctrl_ifloat[]1.0I control value for the actuator.
actuator_ctrl_pfloat[]1.0P control value for the actuator.
actuator_ctrl_speedfloat[]0.2Speed target for the actuator.
actuator_ctrl_max_accfloat[]1.0Acceleration ramps for actuator control.
actuator_ctrl_min_outputfloat[]30.0Minimum output for actuator control.
actuator_ctrl_max_outputfloat[]5000.0Maximum output for actuator control. For curtis, should be typically set to 32767.
actuator_ctrl_slow_fractionfloat[]0.5Limits the maximum output by the fraction value in percentage 0-100% when soft stop is active. 100 means no limitation.
actuator_ctrl_pos_multifloat[]1.0Control output multiplier for positive control direction.
actuator_ctrl_inv_outint[]0Inverse control output.
actuator_crawl_speedfloat0.01Actuator speed when close to target.
actuator_crawl_distfloat0.05Distance [m] from stopping point to move actuator with slower speed.
actuator_speed_lowpass_alphafloat0.25Low-pass filter coefficient for the calculated actuator speed measurement.
trigger_load_unload_sequence_from_poscontint00 = No action, 1 = Trigger load/unload sequence when AGV arrives at Pick-Up/Drop-Off symbolic point. Load or unload action is decided based on load status.
fork_raise_cmdint400Output value for lifting the forks.
fork_low_cmdint-400Output value for lowering the forks.
actuator_up_output_percentageint60Actuator control value in percentage when lifting actuator.
actuator_down_output_percentageint0Actuator control value in percentage when lowering the actuator.
fork_pos_xfloat0.0Fork coordinate X with respect to the AGV navigation point.
fork_pos_yfloat0.0Fork coordinate Y with respect to the AGV navigation point.
apply_actuator_offset_distfloat0.5Distance [m] from end symbolic point to start applying actuator stop offset. If AGV is going to stop before symbolic point, fork_pos_x is added to this distance. If AGV is going to stop after, custom route is created when AGV is within this distance. Not used if fork_pos_x is 0.0.
actuator_speed_loaded_mm_per_sfloat1000.0Actuator speed [mm/s] while loaded.
actuator_speed_not_loaded_mm_per_sfloat1000.0Actuator speed [mm/s] while not loaded.

Racking

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
empty_space_area_width_addition_mfloat0.00Positive value increases the width of the empty space detection area. This value is added to the pallet width to both directions. If this value is 0.05m and width is 0.8m the safety area width is 0.9m.
empty_space_area_length_addition_mfloat0.00Positive value increases the length of the empty space detection area. This value is added to the pallet length to both directions. If this value is 0.05m and length is 1.25m the safety area length is 1.35m.
racking_modeint0Enables racking feature.
racking_min_dist_rack_to_move_actuator_metersfloat2.0Minimum AGV distance [m] from rack to be allowed to move the actuator.
racking_check_point_before_min_dist_rack_offset_mfloat0.5Check before entering the minimum distance from rack that actuator is in target height. Used also when leaving rack to make sure that it is safe to start lowering the actuator.
racking_max_dist_from_rack_begin_lift_actuator_metersfloat5.0The distance [m] of the earliest point to start moving the actuator to rack level.
racking_empty_space_det_height_mmint1000How far from the current shelf we can lift the actuator to check the empty space. By default, the height is taken from the shelf above, but if it is not found this parameter is used.
racking_shelf_height_mmint20Height of the shelf. Used in empty space detection to get the detection height below the rack above. Also used in shelf detection to control the fork below the shelf.
racking_empty_space_check_modeint00 = Disable the check, 1 = Check to the height of the rack above, 2 = Use only racking_empty_space_det_height_mm parameter to define the height.
racking_pallet_det_modeint00 = disabled, 1 = check that pallet is found on Precheck state, 2 = check that pocket is found on Precheck state, 3 = marker detection to localize load.
racking_shelf_max_angle_err_degfloat10.0Maximum allowed angle error for the shelf related to the target symbolic point.
racking_shelf_max_dist_err_mfloat0.2Maximum allowed distance error for the detected shelf center related to the target symbolic point.
racking_shelf_height_to_fork_offset_mmint50Offset for the fork to safely drive in to the shelf. Used in Beam detection, where the shelf height is detected using scanner. This offset is added to the detected height so the fork is on the correct height for driving in.
racking_shelf_height_detection_enabledint00 = disabled, 1 = Use the scanner to search for the shelf height on the Precheck state. Used only when driving to unload.
racking_shelf_min_widthfloat2.0Minimum width of the beam when searhing the shelf height. Used only when racking_shelf_height_detection_enabled is set.
racking_pallet_drag_push_detect_enableint0Enables pallet drag/push detection feature.
racking_pallet_drag_push_dist_tolerancefloat0.05Specifies the tolerance [m] for the pallet to be considered as being pushed or following the AGV.
racking_pallet_drag_push_dist_equality_tolerancefloat0.01Specifies the equality tolerance [m] for the pallet to be considered as being pushed or following the AGV.
racking_pallet_drag_push_max_dist_rack_use_pallet_detectionfloat0.5Specifies the distance [m] between the AGV and the rack to use pallet detection for detecting if the pallet is pushed or dragged.
racking_pallet_drag_push_dist_to_pall_locfloat0.02Specifies the distance [m] between the AGV and the pallet while driving towards pallet location.
racking_enable_raise_err_pall_not_detectedint0Enables raising of error if pallet detection does not detect the pallet and if the distance to pallet is not available.
racking_pallet_drag_push_timer_lower_limit_usint400000Timer minimum value for pallet drag push feature. The distance to pallet is sampled after the timer value surpasses this value.
racking_pallet_drag_push_timer_upper_limit_usint500000Timer maximum value for pallet drag push feature. The distance to pallet is considered valid if obtained before the timer value surpasses this value.
racking_disable_symbol_point_cacheint0Disables the symbol point cacheing optimization feature.

Buffer lanes

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
buffer_allow_drive_end_update_when_safety_is_disabledint0If new drive order is received to the same destination when fork is set to floor level: 0 = keep the previous drive end, 1 = allows to update drive end point. Related to parameter disable_safety_distance_on_buffer. If AGV has pallet detection scanner that can be used when fork is at floor level, set this to 1, otherwise 0.
buffer_stop_dist_from_object_when_unloadingfloat-2.0Stopping distance [m] from the closest object, when unloading in a buffer. Calculated from navigation point to the scanner measurements seen on the buffer zone.
buffer_lanes_enabledint0Enables buffer lane feature.
load_buffer_modeint30 = none, 1 = detect any objects based on scanner measurements, 2 = detect a pallet, 3 = external sensor (Load Detected bit on Supervisor status actuator section or CAN).
unload_buffer_modeint10 = none, 1 = detect any objects based on scanner measurements, 2 = detect a pallet.
buffer_check_start_dist_offset_mfloat2.0Higher the value, earlier the machine starts checking, if the buffer is free for unloading or if there is pallet for loading.
buffer_stop_dist_from_object_when_loadingfloat0.0Stopping offset [m] for load buffer. Calculated from navigation point to the object or to the point where the external sensor is triggered.
buffer_trigger_unload_with_pause_messageint00 = normal pause mode, 1 = trigger unload if Pause (supervisor message 3006) is received on the unload buffer area.
buffer_max_dist_from_route_to_targetfloat0.2Maximum transverse distance where the target can be from the route. If target is further away than this parameter, AGV is stopped. Also used as docking start condition (if it is enabled).
buffer_stop_AGV_when_decreasing_fork_before_loadint10 = Allow AGV drive while lowering the fork, 1 = stop the AGV until the fork is decreased to the floor level. Used only if disable_safety_distance_to_load_or_unload is used.
buffer_stop_distance_from_unwanted_objectfloat1.0Distance to stop the AGV in front of object if using pallet detection. The distance is calculated from AGV frame. The AGV should continue driving when object is removed. Negative value stops the AGV immediately.
load_buffer_slow_down_distancefloat-1.0Distance to start slow down before target in m. Uses the disable_safety_limit_speed. Negative not used.
unload_buffer_slow_down_distancefloat-1.0Distance to start slow down before target in m. Uses the disable_safety_limit_speed. Negative not used.
unload_buffer_error_when_lane_fullint0Trigger fatal error if unload buffer lane is detected to be full when bringing a load.

Blockstacking

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
stack_loading_enabledint0Enables stackloading feature.
stack_loading_step_mmint1How much [mm] the lift reference is changed in each step when scanning the stack.
stack_loading_occupancy_min_hitsint0Minimum scannerpoints requiredinoccupancyarea,0=disableoccupancycheck.
stack_loading_min_hits_top_legsint2Howmanytimesthelegsarerequiredtodetectbeforethe pocket low level is stored.
stack_loading_min_hits_falseint7How many false detections are required before stopping the lifting.
stack_loading_stop_increaseint3What method is used for stopping lifting: 0 = none, 1 = leg detection, 2 = line model and leg detection, 3 = occupancy check, 4 = 3D camera, 5 = fork is moved to estimated height.
stack_loading_max_dist_to_pallet_mfloat1.0Disable pallets if they are further detected than this value [m]. Used only with target_detection_type_selection = 2. Calculated from the scanner to the pallet front side.
stack_loading_dist_to_start_increase_mfloat1.0Distance from navigation point to target stopping point to start lifting the fork.
stack_loading_min_pocket_size_mmint10Minimum pocket size [mm] to allow docking. If pocket is smaller, choose the next pocket.
stack_loading_max_pocket_size_mmint150Maximum pocket size [mm] to allow docking. If pocket is higher, choose the next pocket.
stack_loading_min_false_hits_legsint2How many times the legs are required to false detect before detecting it as a false.
stack_loading_enable_soft_stopint00 = Softstop is used only when lifting the fork to the top pallet level, 1 = Enable softstop also when lowering the fork back to route level after driving out.
stack_loading_max_height_mmint3000Themaximumforkheightforthescan.Iftheforkreachesthisvalue,errorisset or lifting is stopped and fork is lowered to the pocket. Depending on stack_loading_max_height_raises_error.
stack_loading_max_height_raises_errorint1If the fork height goes over the maximum allowed height 0 = stop lifting the fork and lower it to found pocket, 1 = set error.
stack_loading_max_height_to_load_from_floor_mmint2000The maximum fork height after scan is ready where the fork can still be lowered to floor. If the fork is higher than this value and the pocket is found on the floor, error is set. Used to avoid picking multiple pallets.
stack_loading_stop_increase_height_mmint0Lifting is stopped when the legs are not seen within this height. If set to 0, the stack_loading_min_hits_false is used for stop.
stack_loading_max_decrease_val_after_scan_mmint0Maximum allowed lowering when the scan is done. Used to avoid selecting pocket from too low height. Recommended value is the maximum pallet height + some error. 0 not used
stack_loading_min_decrease_val_after_scan_mmint0Minimum allowed lowering when the scan is done. Used to avoid selecting pocket too close to the stack top. Recommended value is the minimum pallet height - some error. 0 not used
stack_loading_max_retry_if_scanning_failsint0Maximum number of retries if scanning doesn't find the pocket.
stack_loading_disable_linear_model_while_increasingint0Disables pallet detection linear model if it is activated while scanning the stack.
stack_loading_dist_from_stack_to_move_actuatorfloat1.5Distance [m] from navigation point to the detected pallet front line where actuator can be controlled safely without hitting the stack.
block_stacking_modeint0Mode for detecting the top pallet: 0 = none, 1 = Occupancy check, 2 = pallet detection, 3 = fork sensor, 4 = 3D camera, 5 = fork is moved to estimated height.
block_stacking_offset_mmint0Offset [mm] from the sensor detection height to the actuator.
block_stacking_reference_step_mmint2Increase value [mm] added to the current height on each step.
block_stacking_max_detection_wait_time_msint30000Max wait time in ms for target detection in front of the stack. Used in both dropoff and pickup and with 3D camera and external target detection.
block_stacking_use_scanner_to_check_safetyint0Use scanner to check if blockstacking is safe to start. Checks occupancy on top of the pallet where the blockstacking should be done. If there is already something, blockstacking is not started. 1 = rear, 2 = front scanner
block_stacking_max_diff_on_target_posfloat0.2Maximum difference allowed to the target location.
block_stacking_dist_to_check_load_sensorfloat-1.0Distance from the unload location to AGV to check if load sensor detects still pallet when driving away from unload location. AGV is stopped if the sensor detects pallet.Negative=notused.
block_stacking_dist_to_unloadfloat-2.0Distance [m] from detected target to the unload location. Calculated from target's front line to the navigation point.
block_stacking_target_max_diff_from_routefloat0.1How far [m] the target can be from the route to start block stacking sequence. If the target is too far, normal unload is done.
block_stacking_min_actuator_val_after_ready_mmint200> 0 Use softstop to move the fork to this parameter value when driving away from stack. 0 = move the fork while driving
block_stacking_target_max_heading_diff_degfloat15.0The maximum angle difference between target and the AGV for starting the sequence [deg].
block_stacking_overshoot_height_mmint150How much [mm] the actuator should be lifted when the sensor does not see anything.Usedtocheckthatweareactuallyontop of the stack and not on the pocketwhenusingforksensors. Recommended value is bit higher than the height of the pocket.
block_stacking_max_height_mmint799Maximumallowedheight [mm]for actuator duringthelifting phase. If actuator goes over this height, unload is done to the floor if AGV is inside the buffer area. If AGV is outside the buffer area, it waits for new drive order.
block_stacking_max_dist_to_targetfloat2.0Distance [m]fromnavigationpointtotargettostartblock stacking sequence.
block_stacking_max_extend_drivefloat0.2Maximum allowed distance [m] to extend the drive after stopped with unload buffer if fork sensor is not triggered.
block_stacking_verify_unload_height_mmint00=notused.Verifyunloadwithload sensor,byloweringtheactuatorforvalueofthisparameterandcheckingthesensorstatus.Ifsensordetectsthepalletwhenlowered bythisamount,error istriggered.Ifthesensordoesn'tdetectthepalletduringthedecrease,actuator is stopped and unload is considered to be ready.
block_stacking_verify_unload_height_sensor_offset_mmint00=notused.Offsetvaluefortheactuatorwhentheactuatorisstoppedusingtheloadsensor.
block_stacking_disable_fork_sensor_distfloat1.2Distance from unload location to navigation point to disable fork sensor triggering normal unload after the height is set and when approaching to unload position.
block_stacking_reset_distance_from_increase_locationfloat0.5Distance to reset the state machine if AGV is far enough from the location where the increase starts.
block_stacking_max_unload_error_behind_SPfloat0.05Tolerance for calculated unload point behind symbolic point. If it is more than this parameter, stacking is not done and unload will be done in front of the pallet.
block_stacking_pyramid_length_offset_mmint0The length offset for pyramid stacking. Only enabled if the pyramid stacking flag is received from Fleet Control.
block_stacking_dist_from_stack_to_move_actuatorfloat0.0Distance [m] from navigation point to the detected pallet front line where actuator can be controlled safely without hitting the stack.
block_stacking_resource_height_mmint0Hardcoded pallet height. Can be used to test without sensor data.

Target and obstacle detection

Target detection

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
target_detection_type_selectionint0Selects type of target detection: 0 = disabled, 1 = reflector detection, 2 = pallet detection, 3 = pallet detection ver 2, 4 = external target detection, 5 = supervisor controlled.
target_detection_always_enabledint0Enables always target detection algorithm, otherwise target is only detected when docking.
target_detection_scan_selectionint1Defines which scanners are used for target detection: 0 = enable target_detection_multi_scan_selection, 1 = rear scanner only, 2 = front scanner only, 3 = both scanners (not supported with target_detection_type_selection = 2), 4 = use scanner in driving direction (front or rear), 5 = alternate between scanners.
target_detection_multi_scan_selectionint[]0Selects which scanner to use for target detection in different situations. Indexes: 0=rear, 1=front, 2=meas0, 3=meas1. 1 = use as only scanner, 2 = together with others (all at once), 3 = alternating with other as primary, 4 = alternating with other as secondary, 5 = use when driving forwards, 6 = use when driving backwards, 7 = use when driving transversal right, 8 = use when driving transversal left, 9 = use when AGV has load, 10 = use when AGV doesn't have load.
target_detection_scan_use_local_coordinatesint00 = Use scanner data in world coordinates, 1 = local coordinates.
target_detection_results_dampeningfloat0.3Dampening value for the results: minimum = 0, maximum = 1.
target_detection_height_result_dampeningfloat0.3Dampening value for the target height detection: minimum = 0, maximum = 1.
target_detection_max_diff_in_xy_resultsfloat0.20How much difference [m] is allowed in xy-location before the new result is updated without dampening.
target_detection_max_diff_in_angle_resultsfloat5.0How much difference [deg] is allowed in angle before the new result is updated without dampening.
target_detection_max_diff_in_height_resultsfloat0.15How much difference [m] is allowed in height before the new result is updated without dampening.
target_min_n_times_detectedint20Minimum number of times target must be detected before giving results.
target_max_n_times_missingint300Maximum number of times last known location for target is given if no target detected: Minimum = 0
target_detection_max_dist_to_symbolic_pointfloat6.0Maximum distance from AGV to the end point to start the algorithm.
target_detection_simulation_enabledint00 = disabled, 1 = If simulating Navigation SW, gives some fixed results from the target detection function, 2 = force fixed simulated results even Navigation SW not on sim mode.
target_detection_supervisor_update_message_enabledint10 = Disabled, 1 = Use message 4101, 2 = Use message 4105 (contains more info).
target_detection_supervisor_update_message_interval_msint200Defines the send interval of the target detection update message. 0 = minimum (send on every cycle), 10000 = maximum.
target_detection_actuator_offset_to_scanner_mmint0Scanner height offset relative to the actuator. Negative means that scanner is below the actuator. Used in racking pocket detection and stackloading.
target_detection_max_rendering_distance_from_sym_pointfloat3.1Target is only rendered if it is closer to the symbolic point than this distance.
target_detection_maximum_iterationsint10The maximum number of target detection iterations.
target_detection_min_search_radiusfloat0.0Defines the minimum search radius [m] around the expected target location, such as symbolic point, from which the target is searched.
target_verification_distance_from_sym_pointfloat0.08Stopping for target position verification at this distance from symbolic point.
target_marker_search_height_mmint0Additional lifting of the actuator over its nominal level for detection purposes.
target_marker_sensor_nbrint0External localisation sensor configured for target marker detection.
target_marker_position_offsetfloat0.0Position offset between marker and lifting (mid) point of the load. Positive value when the marker is on the right of the lifting point when the load is seen from the AGV.
target_marker_stop_accuracy_limitfloat0.01Required stopping accuracy to end point of the correction drive.
refl_det_num_of_reflectorsint4Number of reflectors used for docking calculations. Must be either 2 or 4.
refl_det_refl_widthfloat0.15Width of the reflectors used for target detection purposes [m].
refl_det_refl_dist_Afloat0.55The distance between the reflectors in the middle [m] (from one centre point of a reflector to another centre point).
refl_det_refl_dist_Bfloat0.65The distance between the reflector on the sides [m] (not used with 2 refs, with 4 refs left and right pair).
refl_det_refl_width_max_errorfloat0.05Maximum allowed error for the width of the reflector [m].
refl_det_refl_dist_max_errorfloat0.06Maximum allowed error for the distance between reflectors [m].
refl_det_min_points_in_clusterint5Minimum number of meas points in reflectors, recommended value 5.
refl_det_lin_mod_point_thresholdfloat0.07Linear threshold [m].
refl_det_refl_dist_patternfloat[]0.0Distances [m] between reflectors in pattern measured from center to center of the reflectors. The array should contain distances from leftmost [0] to rightmost [N].
refl_det_versionint1Use reflector detection version 1-symmetric, 2-pattern 3-pattern with height detection. Defaults to old symmetric version.
target_detection_combine_max_xy_difffloat0.02How much difference [m] is allowed in xy-location to combine results from different scanners.
target_detection_combine_max_ang_diff_degfloat0.1How much angle difference [deg] is allowed to combine results from different scanners.
refl_det_scan_offset_cancelint2How many times a measurement can differ much before the scanner offset is considered out of range.
refl_det_scan_offset_confirmint20How many times measurements must be within range before the scanner offset is considered stable.
pattern_detection_refl_board_pos_xfloat0.0The x deviation between navigation point and pattern detection board's centre.
pattern_detection_refl_board_pos_yfloat0.0The y deviation between navigation point and pattern detection board's centre.
pattern_detection_refl_board_angle_degfloat0.0The heading deviation between pattern detection board and AGV frame heading.
pallet_model_enabledint[]-1Enables that pallet model to be used for detection.
pallet_model_descriptionstring[]
pallet_model_width_yfloat[]0.0Total width of the pallet (measured from stringer board).
pallet_model_length_xfloat[]0.0Total length of the pallet.
pallet_model_n_legs_xint[]0Number of legs (2 or 3) in X-direction (lengthwise).
pallet_model_n_legs_yint[]0Number of legs (2 or 3) in Y-direction (widthwise).
pallet_model_mid_leg_width_yfloat[]0.0Width (y-dimension) of the legs in middle column.
pallet_model_mid_leg_length_xfloat[]0.0Length (x-dimension) of the legs in middle column.
pallet_model_side_leg_width_yfloat[]0.0Width (y-dimension) of the legs on both side columns.
pallet_model_side_leg_length_xfloat[]0.0Length (x-dimension) of the legs on both side columns.
pallet_model_y_offsetfloat[]0.0Offset in y-coordinate for docking (in machine coordinates).
pallet_model_stop_distancefloat[]0.0Defines how close to the target vehicle tries to drive (calculated from navigation point to target).
pallet_model_min_dist_from_nav_point_to_traj_endfloat[]-1.0Model specific distance from navigation point to trajectory end where the target is locked and not updated anymore. -1.0 = disabled and the generic parameter pallet_det_2_min_dist_from_nav_point_to_traj_end is used instead.
pallet_model_discard_outlier_pointsint[]0Discard outlier points on leg cluster. Uses average distance on cluster to detect outliers. Might be useful if the leg length is small and there are no points to see on the side.
pallet_model_max_pocket_pointsint[]10How many points are allowed to be between front row legs, that does not belong to any leg. If found more points between the legs, solution is discarded.
pallet_model_pocket_area_front_line_addfloat[]-0.02How much the pocket area front line is moved [m], positive is towards the rear of the pallet.
pallet_model_pocket_area_rear_line_addfloat[]0.00How much the pocket area rear line is moved [m], positive is towards the rear of the pallet.
pallet_model_definition_modeint1Defines where the pallet model information is to be obtained: 0 = None, 1 = Parameters, 2 = Supervisor
pallet_det_linear_models_enabledint1Enables pallet detection from stringer board (top part of the pallet), which can be seen as a line.
pallet_det_object_det_enabledint0Enables object detection so that instead of pallets any cluster of scanner points inside the search area is detected as a target. target_detection_type_selection must have value 3 for this parameter to have an effect.
pallet_det_lin_mod_point_thresholdfloat0.07Maximum distance between points [m], when detecting a pallet from stringer board.
pallet_det_limit_initial_search_angfloat20.0Limits the search field of view in front of the scanner for the first leg [+-deg].
pallet_det_use_dynamic_search_angint1If set to 1, algorithm dynamically makes the search field of view bigger, if the target to be detected is closer and vice versa (pallet det v2 does not use this paramter).
pallet_det_limit_search_spacefloat3.00Limits the searching space in front of the laser scanner. Maximum distance [m] sideways for points to be considered for pallet. (pallet det v2 does not use this parameter)
pallet_det_first_leg_ang_weightfloat0.75The two factors deciding the location for the first leg of the pallet we try to detect are angle and distance compared to the expected location. If parameter is bigger, having small angle errors is more important than distance error.
pallet_det_point_filter_distfloat0.10Filters all the points from calculations, which don't have any close neighbours within this distance [m]. Not used with pallet dev v2.
pallet_det_leg_dist_errfloat0.5Scales how much error is allowed for the points in the side legs (measured from the supposed center points). Allowed distance error is this parameter multiplied with pallet leg width, so the dimensions of the model also affect the result.
pallet_det_leg_dist_err_backfloat0.07How much distance error [m] is allowed for points in clusters behind the first row.
pallet_det_leg_ang_errfloat7.0How many degrees of error is allowed for individual points in the first row of legs.
pallet_det_leg_ang_err_backfloat2.5After detecting the legs and correcting the cluster locations, how many degrees of errors is allowed for the cluster location compared to expected for the legs behind the first row to be valid.
pallet_det_max_leg_dist_errfloat0.07How many meters of distance error is allowed for the cluster locations compared to expected in the first row of legs for the whole solution to be valid. If error is bigger, solution is not accepted at all.
pallet_det_max_leg_ang_errfloat7.0How many degrees of error is allowed for the cluster locations compared to expected in the first row of legs for the whole solution to be valid. If error is bigger, solution is not accepted at all.
pallet_det_min_points_in_clusterint[]5Minimum number of measurement points in leg, second limit for a smaller leg, recommended values 5 for first and 4 for second. Index 0: How many points are required on a cluster to define it as a leg. Index 1: If the side leg width (pallet_model_side_leg_width_y) is smaller than 0.11, this parameter is used instead.
pallet_det_wall_checkint[]0Enable wall checks, can be 0, 1 or 2, recommended values 1 for first and 0 for second. With value 1 on the first, the algorithm discards the solution, if between the legs the holes are not seen, or if on the sides of the legs it looks like there is a wall instead of empty space. With value 2, a single wall is enough to discard the model. With value 1 on the second parameter, the solution is discarded if the holes between the legs are not detected and there is no wall next to the outer legs. Used for example, if the detected model is actually larger than should be (outer legs detected instead of the inner ones).
pallet_det_wall_check_pointsint6Affects how many points at maximum from the leg are checked in the wall checks, before a decision is made that if there is empty space or not.
pallet_det_wall_point_dist_thresholdfloat0.05Maximum distance [m] between points, that they are estimated to be linked together in the wall checks.
pallet_det_new_validity_checkint1New check for pallet validity. Pallet model is discarded if at least validity_check_discard_ratio of points are further away than pallet_det_wall_point_dist_threshold * 10.
pallet_det_new_validity_check_min_discard_ratiofloat0.3Percentage of how many outlier points are required from the total point count before pallet model is discarded.
pallet_det_correction_recursion_enabledint1If set to 1, if cluster correction algorithm doesn't find points that could be used for correcting the location, the function can be called recursively (for max 10 times) with a wider search angle. If 0, the search angles are always fixed and wider.
pallet_det_cluster_correction_angle_offsetfloat0.0On default no offset given, but if the shape of the leg requires this (some non-standard non-square shape). Changing off the offset requires in most case testing with different values to see how it exactly behaves, so no clear instructions can't be given for how to use it.
pallet_det_cluster_corr_modeint0On default setting of 0 tries to correct X- and Y- directions independently. On 1, tries to check points only on the nearest corner to the scanner and corrects both directions based on this.
pallet_det_y_corr_threshold_angfloat4.0If the angle difference from laser to the leg compared to leg heading is really small (smaller than this parameter), we don't really see either side of the leg so it's better to just calculate an average of the Y-direction.
pallet_det_cluster_corr_min_pointsint1Minimum number of points used when correcting pallet legs. If 0 points found, making a correction is not possible. If there is a lot of variance and noice in individual points, should be set higher than 1.
pallet_det_cluster_distfloat[]0.90Distance check multiplier for leg points in first row of legs. Index 0: Distance check multiplier for leg points in first row of legs. Index 1: Distance check multiplier for leg points in second and third row of legs. Index 2: Diagonal distance multiplier.
pallet_det_front_row_weightfloat3.0How much weight is given for the front row of legs compared to other legs, when calculating the final result of XYH for pallet. Front row is usually seen more accurately, so on default it has more weight.
pallet_det_fitness_weightfloat[]1.0Array to change weight of the different parts for how good a solution is considered to be, if several are found (bigger scale means bigger weight). fit0 is the first found leg on the middle. fit1 how many legs found in the first row. fit2 number of legs in the back rows, solutions with more found legs are preferred. fit3 the difference between center of the pallet compared to the expected location. fit4 angle of the target compared to the expected (symbolic point heading basically). fit5 cluster width compared to model leg width. fit6 cluster outer distance compared to model width. fit7 is for determining the heading ambiguity of asymmetric pallets.
pallet_det_allow_only_middle_legint0If set to 1, accept only solutions for 3-leg pallets, where the closest leg to a line drawn from the navigation point towards the direction of the scanner (straight fw or bw) is the middle leg instead of a side leg.
pallet_det_split_thresholdfloat0.06Used for deciding, if one cluster should be splitted into separate clusters. A line is calcualted between start and end point and then the distance of cluster points is compared to this line. If there is a point with longer distance from the line defined by this parameter [m], cluster is splitted.
pallet_det_linear_model_max_errfloat0.07Maximum difference [m] between the found line model and width of the pallet model for solution to be accepted.
pallet_det_min_dist_from_scannerfloat0.20Minimum distance from scanner to pallet that pallet position is updated. Pallet det v2 uses this only to discard points that are closer to the scanner than this parameter.
pallet_det_min_points_close_to_first_pointint3Minimum number of points next to the first point we are searching for.
pallet_det_heading_offsetfloat0.0Heading offset [deg] added to the target angle.
pallet_det_2_min_dist_from_nav_point_to_traj_endfloat0.50Minimum distance from navigation point to trajectory end that pallet position is locked and not updatedd anymore. This parameter is ignored, if model specific distances are defined.
pallet_det_2_max_dist_to_first_pointfloat0.05Maximum difference between consecutive closest points.
pallet_det_2_initial_search_model_width_addfloat0.50Increase the search area by adding this value to the model width.
pallet_det_2_detect_only_front_legsint0If set to 1, algorithm detects only first legs and calculates target position based on this. Sometimes increases accuracy, because front legs are seen most accurately.
pallet_det_2_max_dist_to_routefloat0.2Maximum distance to the route (line that is aligned to the route heading). Calculated from the pallet centre. If the pallet is found further that this parameter, that result is discarded.
pallet_det_2_cluster_only_based_on_distance_and_indexint0Create clusters based on distance between points (pallet_det_lin_mod_point_threshold) and index.
pallet_det_2_min_leg_cluster_coveragefloat0.7Minimum average fraction value of percentage for legs to cover the cluster. If the percentage is lower, that model is discarded. Uses fit5 value as the percentage.
pallet_det_2_max_pallet_width_errorfloat0.2Maximum error between pallet width compared to side legs outer distance [m]. If the error is higher, that model is discarded. Uses fit6 value as the error.
pallet_det_2_fitness_cost_percentage_for_unwanted_clusterfloat0.8Fraction value of percentage cost for the total fitness if found cluster between the side legs. Used only with two-legged pallets and only on the front row. Negative values discards the result.
pallet_det_2_min_points_to_create_unwanted_clusterint4How many scanner points are required between the side legs to try creating unwanted cluster.
pallet_det_2_max_point_diff_for_unwanted_clusterint4How many points less are needed on the cluster on the middle related to the amount on the side legs. Used to find only similar size cluster as the side legs.
pallet_det_2_max_pallet_angle_errorfloat30.00Maximum angle [deg] for the pallet related to the symbolic point heading.
pallet_det_2_max_error_multiplier_for_outlier_pointfloat1.4Multiplier for maximum distance error for outlier points. Used to discard points from cluster if pallet_model_discard_outlier_points is enabled.
pallet_det_2_lock_model_if_found_number_of_timesint00 = not used. How many times same model is required to detect in a row before searching only that model.
pallet_det_linear_model_max_point_idx_diffint3Maximum difference between consecutive points when searching the linear model.
pallet_det_maximum_target_pose_errorfloat0.2Maximum target distance deviation between estimated centre point and target.
pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_widthfloat0.1Margin for width of polygon for clustering.
pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_lengthfloat0.1Margin for length of polygon for clustering.
pallet_det_2_relative_target_det_after_lockingint0Enables relative target detection (in local machine coordinates) after target has been locked.
pallet_det_table_leg_cluster_coveragefloat0.5Minimum fraction of legs to cover the cluster. If the fraction is lower, that cluster is discarded. Too small may result in false-positive, too large in false-negative.
occup_check_enabledint0Enables occupancy check around symbolic point. AGV stops if it detects that zone linked to symbolic point is occupied.
occup_check_start_distfloat3.0Distance [m] to symbolic point to trigger occupancy check. Measured from the front or rear of the vehicle depending of driving direction.
occup_check_stop_distfloat0.2Distance [m] to symbolic point to stop checking occupancy.
occup_check_min_hitsint1Minimum hits required in occupancy area to stop the vehicle.
occup_check_min_hits_modeint1How the minimum hits are calculated: 1 = Total points from all assigned scanners, 2 = Points from at least one assigned scanner, 3 = Points from every assigned scanner.
occup_check_scan_selectionint1Defines which scanners are used for occupancy check: Bit 0 = rear scanner, Bit 1 = front scanner, Bit 2 = measurement 0 scanner, Bit 3 = measurement 1 scanner.
occup_check_modeint0Occupancy check mode: 0 = check always, 1 = disable when AGV is not carrying a load, 2 = disable when AGV carries a load, 3 = disable for a Pick up symbolic point when AGV is not carrying a load.
ext_target_det_sensor_x_posfloat0.0External target detection sensor x position with respect to the AGV navigation point.
ext_target_det_sensor_y_posfloat0.0External target detection sensor y position with respect to the AGV navigation point.
ext_target_det_sensor_angle_degfloat0.0External target detection sensor heading with respect to the AGV heading.
ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_msint500External target detection data is sent to supervisor every second when target is not detected. This parameter defines the update interval when target detection is activated. 0 = Expect target detection only once when requested.
ext_target_det_measurement_delay_msint50Delay of sensor measurement [ms] relative to AGV position measurements.
ext_target_min_dist_from_traj_end_to_nav_pointfloat0.40Minimum distance from navigation point to trajectory end that target position is still updated.
ext_target_det_target_rendering_widthfloat0.9External target detection target width when rendered to Monitor. Does not affect to any calculations.
ext_target_det_target_rendering_lengthfloat0.4External target detection target length when rendered to Monitor. Does not affect to any calculations.
ext_target_det_height_modeint00 = External target detection z value is used as reference height for actuator. E.g. z = 0.9m, actuator reference will be 900mm. 1 = z value is in sensor coordinates. E.g. value 0.2m would lift actuator 200mm from its current height.
ext_target_det_response_timeout_msint2000Time to wait [ms] for target detection response. Error is set if Navitrol doesn't receive response within this time. If set to 0, error is never set. Only used when ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms is 0.

3D Target detection

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
obj_reg_3d_region_of_interest_min_xfloat1.0Minimum x value for passthrough filtering - sensor coordinates.
obj_reg_3d_region_of_interest_max_xfloat4.5Maximum x value for passthrough filtering - sensor coordinates.
obj_reg_3d_region_of_interest_min_zfloat0.0Minimum z value for passthrough filtering - w.r.t. floor level.
obj_reg_3d_region_of_interest_max_zfloat0.6Maximum z value for passthrough filtering - w.r.t. floor level.
obj_reg_3d_number_of_pointcloud_logsint0The number of error pointcloud logs dumped to directory.
obj_reg_3d_pointcloud_loggingint0A pointcloud log is dumped each iteration, regardless of error.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_translation_xfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration from AGV centre point x [m].
obj_reg_3d_sensor_translation_yfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration from AGV centre point y [m].
obj_reg_3d_sensor_translation_zfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration from actuator height [m].
obj_reg_3d_sensor_internal_rotation_roll_degfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration roll. Sensor's internal coordinate frame.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_internal_rotation_pitch_degfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration pitch. Sensor's internal coordinate frame.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_internal_rotation_yaw_degfloat[]0.0Sensor calibration yaw. Sensor's internal coordinate frame.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_external_rotation_yaw_degfloat[]0.0The angular deviation between the 3d sensor's forward direction and AGV's X in machine coordinate frame (heading).
obj_reg_3d_distance_between_pallet_legsfloat[]0.0Distance between pallet legs, to minimize false positives.
obj_reg_3d_object_lengthfloat[]0.0The length of the object.
obj_reg_3d_object_widthfloat[]0.0The width of the object.
obj_reg_3d_object_heightfloat[]0.0The height of the object.
obj_reg_3d_model_namestring[]
obj_reg_3d_cluster_tolerance_distfloat0.096Euclidean clustering distance tolerance [m].
obj_reg_3d_cluster_min_sizeint40Minimum cluster size.
obj_reg_3d_minimum_model_inlierfloat0.25The minimum inlier fraction between model and scene pointcloud.
obj_reg_3d_intensity_filter_scalefloat0.85Intensity filter scale factor (0-1.0).
obj_reg_3d_stop_for_target_detection_distfloat2.0Maximum distance from the object before AGV stops and tries detection on standstill. Distance from AGV's navigation point to the detected object.
obj_reg_3d_target_min_n_times_validated_consecutivelyint2Minimum number of times target must be validated consecutively before giving results.
obj_reg_3d_target_max_n_times_measured_while_stoppedint15The maximum detection attempts at standstill until driving closer to target.
obj_reg_3d_max_diff_in_xy_resultsfloat0.03How much difference [m] is allowed in xy-location between two consecutive object positions.
obj_reg_3d_max_diff_in_angle_results_degfloat2.5How much difference [deg] is allowed in angle between two consecutive object positions.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_modelint[]03D sensor model: -1 = Unity, 0 = disabled, 1 = IFM O3D, 2 = SICK Visionary-T Mini, 3 = Fastdds
obj_reg_3d_sensor_ipstring[]
obj_reg_3d_sensor_height_fixedint[]0The 3d sensor height is independent of actuator: 0 = dynamic height, 1 = static
obj_reg_3d_sensor_fov_vertical_degfloat[]0.0The sensor's vertical field of view [deg]. Used for empty space detection and pose verification.
obj_reg_3d_sensor_fov_horizontal_degfloat[]0.0The sensor horizontal field of view [deg]. Used for empty space detection and pose verification.
obj_reg_3d_enabledint0Enables 3D detection feature.
obj_reg_3d_min_rack_beam_widthfloat1.2Minimum detected rack beam width.
obj_reg_3d_empty_space_min_material_widthfloat0.3Minimum solid material width beneath empty space.
obj_reg_3d_empty_space_width_marginfloat0.1Empty space width margin [m].
obj_reg_3d_empty_space_length_marginfloat0.1Empty space length margin [m].
obj_reg_3d_empty_space_height_marginfloat0.1Empty space height margin [m].
obj_reg_3d_empty_space_max_cluster_densityint50Maximum number of allowed measurement points per cubic meter inside empty space.
obj_reg_3d_view_blocked_by_load_aboardint0Define if 3d camera view is blocked by pallet onboard.

Obstacle detection and avoidance

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
obst_av_modeint0Defines the obstacle avoidance mode: 0 = disabled, 1 = only detect obstacles, 2 = detect and drive around the obstacles.
obst_free_zone_leftfloat0.25The margin [m] around the AGV left dimension that has to be free of obstacles.
obst_free_zone_rightfloat0.25The margin [m] around the AGV right dimension that has to be free of obstacles.
obst_free_zone_frontfloat0.25The margin [m] around the AGV front dimension that has to be free of obstacles.
obst_free_zone_rearfloat0.25The margin [m] around the AGV rear dimension that has to be free of obstacles.
obst_distance_to_begin_planningfloat8.0Distance [m] along the trajectory from AGV to obstacle to begin planning the bypass.
obst_bypass_velocityfloat0.3Maximum speed [m/s] during the obstacle bypass when out of nominal route.
obst_detect_obstacles_distfloat9.Maximum distance [m] from which obstacles are polled along the trajectory.
obst_moving_det_tresholdfloat0.5Minimum obstacle speed [m/s] to count it as moving.
obst_detect_min_scan_pointsint4Amount of colliding scan points required to start obstacle avoidance.
obst_detect_resolution_cmint5Resolution of collision detection [cm].
obst_moving_wait_time_msint4000Time [ms] to wait if obstacle moves before replanning.
obst_return_wait_time_sint10Time [s] to try replanning before returning back to nominal route.
obst_replan_wait_time_msint2000Time [ms] to wait between consecutive replans.
obst_avoidance_sleep_msint300Minimum time [ms] between obstacle avoidance checks.
obst_bypass_edge_safety_additionfloat0.25Additional free space between obstacle and AGV during bypass for the trajectory. Compensates scanner noise and should be set according to that.
obst_bypass_trajectory_max_angle_degfloat45.0Maximum angle [deg] that the AGV has to turn when bypassing-
obst_detection_scannersint3Defines which localization scanners are used for obstacle detection: 0 = none, 1 = rear scanner only, 2 = front scanner only, 3 = both scanners
obst_detection_meas_scannersint0Defines which measurement scanners are used for obstacle detection: 0 = none, 1 = first scanner only, 2 = second scanner only, 3 = both scanners
obst_use_zonesint11 = Only bypass in obstacle avoidance zones defined in tools, 2 = Detect and bypass obstacles only inside zones
obst_detect_movingint1Detects if obstacles are moving.
obst_omni_constant_frame_headingint1Uses constant frame heading for omni machines when driving around the obstacle.
obst_max_obstacle_bypassedfloat100.0Limit for bypass length in meters along the nominal trajectory.
obst_bypass_through_static_environmentint00 = disabled, bypass is not planned through map points. 1 = only scanner points used in bypass route planning
obst_first_nodes_parallel_to_trajint0Creates the first nodes parallel to current trajectory instead of bypass route.
obst_drive_near_close_obstacleint0Whether to keep going when an obstacle is too close but not clashing directly with agv frame. 0 = stop, 1 = keep going
obst_close_obstacle_safety_zonefloat0.05Distance [m] around the agv that is used to check close obstacles when obst_drive_near_close_obstacle is set to 1.
obst_return_to_nominal_max_dist_difffloat0.10Maximum distance to return to nominal route target point to determine returning is complete.
obst_return_to_nominal_max_angle_diff_degfloat5.0Maximum angle to return to nominal route target point to determine returning is complete.
obst_dist_to_stop_before_obstaclefloat0.5Safety distance [m] to stop close to the obstacle. If 0, AGV should stop to the crashing point, but there might be some error.
obst_windowlenint10
obst_limitfloat0.25
obst_npointslimitint0
obst_detection_modeint0Enables obstacle detection feature.
obst_detection_tx_every_nthint1Send obstacle detection data once for every nth scanner measurement.
obst_detection_max_dist_in_objectfloat0.200Maximum distance between scan points for them to be considered the same detected object.
obst_detection_max_dist_from_linefloat0.050Maximum distance a scan point can have from the detected line.

Customer UI

Navitrol Monitor, Tools and fleet control

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
monitoring_software_portint1234Defines the port that monitor software tries to connect.
monitoring_software_allow_control_takeint1Enables Monitor to take control from already connected Monitor.
tools_software_portint6079Port for TCP communication with Navithor Tools.
compress_remote_mon_continous_dataint1Compress continous data sent from Navitrol to Monitor.
compress_remote_mon_event_dataint1Compress event data sent from Navitrol to Monitor.
compress_remote_mon_static_dataint1Compress static data (environment, routes and parameters) sent from Navitrol to Monitor.
fleet_control_portint6007TCP/IP Port where the AGV listens for connections from fleet control.
fleet_control_device_errors_modeint0Controls what device errors are sent to fleet control: 0 = none, 1 = errors received from supervisor, 2 = errors from all devices
fleet_control_err_msg_min_interval_msint1000Controls how often active errors are sent to fleet control [ms].
fleet_control_typeint10 = No fleet control, 1 = Our own fleet control, 2 = External fleet control, 3 = VD(M)A fleet control
set_going_to_id_from_all_drive_ordersint01 = Set going to ID to all trajectory's ending at a symbolic point, even if the ID is not sent in the drive order.
fleet_control_wait_time_for_answer_sint10Maximum time [s] for waiting an answer from the fleet control. After that obstacle avoidance status will be reset. Used also when asking permission to drive other custom routes, error is set on timeout.
send_fleet_every_nth_trajectory_pointint5When sending obstacle bypass or custom route trajectory to fleet control, send every nth point to send less data.
remote_mon_min_send_interval_msint500Maximum acceptable data update and send interval [ms] to Monitor.
remote_mon_send_timeout_msint2000Maximum acceptable time [ms] for sending single data packet to Monitor.
remote_mon_recv_timeout_msint2000Maximum time [ms] to wait data packet from Monitor. Exceeding this time results in reconnect.
report_pp_statusint0Defines which message will be sent in response to a received position correction message: 0 = Send basic reply, 1 = Send reply with precision positioning data.
periodic_st_intervint100How often [ms] to report AGV status to fleet control.
fleet_control_recv_timeout_msint5000Timeout [ms] before detecting the fleet control as disconnected.
fleet_control_abort_on_disconnectint0Abort drive, if connection lost to fleet control.
remote_ctrl_watchdog_msint1000Remote control is disabled if no update is received within this time [ms].
remote_ctrl_idle_start_msint2000After (re)connection all joystick data is required to be 0 for this amount of time [ms] before manual control can be activated.
remote_ctrl_nbr_consecutive_manual_modeint3Number of consecutive manual mode messages required for manual mode activation (glitch filtering).
keyb_ctrl_max_speedfloat0.5Maximum speed [m/s] with keyboard control.
keyb_ctrl_acceleration_rateint2Acceleration rate with keyboard control.
keyb_ctrl_deceleration_rateint4Deceleration rate with keyboard control.
keyb_ctrl_increase_curv_rateint1Curvature increase rate in remote control.
keyb_ctrl_decrease_curv_rateint2Curvature decrease rate in remote control.
keyb_ctrl_max_pivot_speedfloat0.1Keyboard control maximum speed [m/s] in pivot.
keyb_ctrl_max_curvfloat1.0Maximum curvature [1/m] for remote control in normal driving.
web_ctrl_speed_multiplierfloat1.0Multiplier for velocity when using old version of the supervisor remote control section. Otherwise obsolete.
remote_ctrl_stop_ramp_decfloat0.8Deceleration ramp when AGV is commanded to stop in remote control.
remote_ctrl_max_steer_rate_enabledint0Enable steering rate limitations in remote control.
remote_ctrl_max_steer_rate_deg_p_sfloat80.0Reference steering rate limit [Deg/s] when using remote control.
web_ctrl_actuator_max_speed_mm_per_sint2500Maximum speed [mm/s] of actuator when controlled with webinterface.
use_long_machine_type_messageint1Send long machine type (32bit) to fleet control instead of short (16bit).
agv_status_message_versionint2What version of AGV status message to send to fleet control: 0 = old status message, 1 = fleetControlLoadStatus added, 2 = AGVStatusVer2
prevent_fleet_ctrl_driving_in_manualint0Prevent any drive orders from fleet control in manual (e-15 key).

TCP/IP Communication and encryption

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
network_ipv6_enabledint0Enables IPv6 support for server sockets.
network_multicast_interface_namestringName of the specific interface used to receive multicast UDP messages
ssl_enabledint0Enables SSL connections.
ssl_verify_server_certint11 = verify server certificate.
ssl_verify_client_certint11 = verify client certificate.
ssl_agv_certificate_filestring./agv_certs/agv.crtThe name of the certificate file to be used by the AGV.
ssl_agv_key_filestring./agv_certs/agv.keyThe name of the key file to be used by the AGV.
ssl_pem_passwordstringThe password that is used to unlock key&certificate.
ssl_ca_filestring./agv_certs/root.crtThe PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates for verification.
ssl_cipher_liststringThe cipher list for OpenSSL.
ssl_dh_param_filestring./agv_certs/dh_param_2048.pemThe DH parameter file for OpenSSL.
nav_ipc_ipstring0.0.0.0IP address of the device running Navigation SW. This address is sent to the ROS.
output_trigger_duration_msint500Duration [ms] to keep output (for example estop) on before resetting it.
ads_server_ipstringIP adress for remote ADS Server.
ads_server_netidstringNetID for remote ADS server.
ads_enabledint0Enables ADS feature.

PGV Camera

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
ext_loc_enabledint0Enables External localization.
ext_loc_docking_enabledint0Enables Docking feature (no teaching of lines).
ext_loc_docking_versionint1Data matrix code (DMC) Docking version: 1 = Version 1 (V1), 2 = Version 2 (V2)
ext_loc_docking_pos_conf_low_allowedint0Allowd focking with external localization when position confidence low-
ext_loc_teach_modeint2Select how to teach the data matrix tape: 0 = pose not saved, 1 = save pose with a time interval (ext_loc_teach_interval_ms), 2 = save pose only on demand (e.g. Save Pos pressed in WebUI), 3 = save pose with a distance interval (ext_loc_teach_interval_dist).
ext_loc_teach_interval_msint2000Save poses with a time interval [ms] when teach mode is 1.
ext_loc_teach_interval_distfloat0.1Save poses with a distance interval when teach mode is 3.
ext_loc_x_offsetfloat[]0.0Nominal X-coordinate of the sensor in machine coordinate system.
ext_loc_y_offsetfloat[]0.0Nominal Y-coordinate of the sensor in machine coordinate system.
ext_loc_h_offset_degfloat[]0.0Heading of the sensor [deg] in machine coordinate system. Heading angle of focal axis when the axis is in the vertical plane.
ext_loc_focal_orientation_degfloat[]0.0Orientation of camera coordinates around focal axis when mounted vertically, zero when x-right and y-up seen from camera along focal axis.
ext_loc_dist_from_linefloat0.2Maximum distance between the sensor and the data matrix line in map coordinates for the external locaization feature to be activated.
ext_loc_for_pos_ctrl_modeint0Select how PGV sensors are used for position control: 0 = disabled (follow virtual route), 1 = use only one sensor input, 2 = use two sensor when applicable, 3 = always require two sensors.
ext_loc_pos_ctrl_axisint0Data matrix code line lateral coordinate axis: 0 = y-axis, 1 = x-axis
ext_loc_pos_ctrl_max_h_errint45Maximum difference between the route heading and the data matrix line heading in map coordinates. The AGV follows the route normally if the heading difference is too big.
ext_loc_max_time_since_last_meas_msint3000Maximum time [ms] since last valid measurement when inside external localization area. 0 = disabled
ext_loc_max_dist_since_last_measfloat0.0Maximum distance [m] since last valid measurement when inside external localization area. 0.0 = disabled
ext_loc_strict_max_dist_since_last_measfloat0.03Strict maximum distance [m] since last valid measurement when close to symbolic point. Used with data matrix docking (ext_loc_docking_enabled).
ext_loc_heading_filt_alphafloat1.0Filtering gain for the heading measurement of the PGV sensor.
ext_loc_pos_ctrl_onlyint0Use PGV sensor for position control only, not for localization.
ext_loc_pos_ctrl_dist_err_onlyint0Use only distance error measurement for position control, when just one sensor is one the line. Suitable for diff/steer vehicles with sensor(s) outside of navigation point.
ext_loc_max_h_err_degfloat10.0Maximum change between the last heading of the AGV and the calculated heading from the data matrix code. Measurement is interpreted as invalid if change is too much.
ext_loc_max_xy_errfloat0.1Maximum change between the last position of the AGV and the calculated position from the data matrix code. Measurement is interpreted as invalid if the change is too much.
ext_loc_pid_heading_pfloat0.0Position control gain for heading when external localization is used. 0.0 = disabled
ext_loc_pid_dist_pfloat0.0Position control gain for distance when external localization is used. 0.0 = disabled
ext_loc_stop_point_enabledint0Stop point can be given in external localization coordinates.
ext_loc_stop_pointfloat[]0.0External localization stop point X-value. 0.0 = disabled
ext_loc_stop_point_min_agv_dist_from_spfloat0.5AGV needs to be within this distance from the target symbolic point to start checking for the stop point.
