The offsets are uppdated only when both scanners see the entire reflector target. As soon as a part of the target is hidden from either scanner the offsets are frozen and used for correction of the calculation results to give the best fit between the scanners.

The front (left) scanner is the master scanner in the sense, that the detection result is always output without offset correction. The detection result of the rear (right) scanner is auto calibrated based on the offsets. Therefore, the front scanner shall first be calibrated manually to give the correct position of a target in a known location. When the front scanner has been calibrated to a satisfying accuracy, the rear scanner can be calibrated based on the offsets calculated to match the front scanner. This sequence is described stepwise below.

  • Put a target on a 5-10 m distance from the scanners with the target point (center point between the outmost reflectors) on the extension of the center line of the vehicle.

  • Adjust the front scanner x,y-position parameters and angle parameter until the target position result matches the real position and angle.

  • Adjust the rear scanner x,y-position parameters and angle parameter until the target detections with both scanners are approximately in the same position in the Monitor view.

  • Let both scanners detect the entire target for a few minutes. If you are running Navitrol from the console, you will see the calibration result FinalScanPosOffsets every now and then. If you are running Navitrol from boot, you must open an extra console (e.g. Putty) and start a navitrol application in dump line mode to see the offset values. Use command ./Navitrol dumpl 10 FinalScanPosOffsets: to get 10 lines of logged offsets, or use 0 instead of 10 to get continuous output. Quit the continuous logging by a Ctrl-C command.

  • Pick the offset values from the log lines FinalScanPosOffsets: ang -0.266 X -0.015 Y 0.024 and subtract them from the currrent parameter values of scan_rear_sen_ang, scan_rear_x and scan_rear_y in the params.txt file. Then command Navitrol to read in the updated parameter file. If the values are added correctly, the target detections of both scanners should be in the same location on the Monitor screen and the FinalScanPosOffsets should be remarkably smaller than before.

  • The parameter values can be updated a few times to get the best result.

  • The scanner calibration can be verified by changing the parameters scanner_heading_offset_gain, scanner_pos_x_offset_gain and scanner_pos_y_offset_gain all to 0.0 to prevent offset calibration, restart Navitrol and verify that the target detection result from front and rear scanners are approximately the same (below a centimetre from each other). NOTE, that Navitrol must be restarted here to zero the initial offsets. Remember to reset the parameter values back to original if you have zeroed them!

The calibration is now ready and the system can be run in production.

Normal operation of the continuous output version 2 system

When using the system in production, always start Navitrol so that the reflector target is visible for both scanners to ensure that the position offset calculation can calibrate itself.

When the common data field in the data output contains position data, the calibration is ready and the system will give offset corrected position data even when a part of the reflector pattern is hidden.

Drive the AGVs under the load and use the reflector detection results with the following priority:

  1. Prioritize the common data field. The common data is a combination of the separate detections and therefore has the best accuracy and fitness. It is also somewhat filtered for flickering as it is a mean of two detections. If the separate scanners give diverging results, the common data reports the data with better fitness, so also in this case it is better.

  2. If the auto calibration has not worked or goes off because of too big differences in the separate scanner positions, the common data gets empty (all values zero).

    • In this case the front (left) scanner is the master and should preferably be used.

    • If the front (left) scanner has a very low fitness and the rear scanner (right) has a very high fitness the rear scanner data can be used until both scanners see the entire pattern again and the auto calibration can correct the offset. NOTE, that in this case there is an offset between front and rear scanner and it must be taken into account in the AGV control and the rear scanner must then be used until auto calibration can correct the offset again.

The separate front and rear data fields will be zero when less than 3 reflectors are detected with that scanner.

Target detection output of the version 2 system in continuous mode

Positioning result from two scanners with a common part with combined data.

The combined data is empty if only one scanner is used. When two scanners are used, the common data contains a combination of both scanners results always, when the separate results match with a certain accuracy.

There is an automatic offset calibration between the scanners, which is removing small scanner position parameter errors. It is active when both scanners see the whole reflector pattern. When the offset has tuned in, so that both scanners give the same result the common data is filled, even when the scanners are not detecting the entire reflector pattern.

Data fieldTypeLength (bytes)Value / Explanation
Protocol versionUint24
Message IDUint24104
Message lengthUint452
Scanner1 Target XFloat4Target X-coordinate in world coordinates
Scanner1 Target YFloat4Target Y-coordinate in world coordinates
Scanner1 Target AngleFloat4Target Angle in radians in world coordinates
Scanner1 Target foundByte10 - Target not found, N[38] reflectors detected
Scanner1 FitnessByte10100 %
0 - target not found
100 - all reflectors detected, ideal match
Scanner1 commsByte1Scanner communication status : 1 OK
0 Not OK
Scanner2 Target XFloat4Target X-coordinate in world coordinates
Scanner2 Target YFloat4Target Y-coordinate in world coordinates
Scanner2 Target AngleFloat4Target Angle in radians in world coordinates
Scanner2 Target foundByte10 - Target not found, N[38] reflectors detected
Scanner2 FitnessByte10100 %
0 - target not found
100 - all reflectors detected, ideal match
Scanner2 commsByte1Scanner communication status : 1 OK
0 Not OK
Combined Target XFloat4Target X-coordinate in world coordinates
Combined Target YFloat4Target Y-coordinate in world coordinates
Combined Target AngleFloat4Target Angle in radians in world coordinates
Combined Target foundByte10 - Target not found, N[38] reflectors detected
Combined FitnessByte10100 %
0 - target not found
100 - all reflectors detected, ideal match

Setting up and calibrating a version 2 system for target detection and docking

In normal target detection applications for localizing and docking to a target, the version 2 system is set up as the continuous one, except for the measurement mode

I,target_detection_always_enabled, 0 for docking

defining that detection is only activated when approaching a symbolic point with target detection enabled. For more information on docking, see Docking.

Since the target is normally approached with one scanner directed towards the target, the scanner selection is set to one scanner use:

I,target_detection_scan_selection, 1 - rear scanner only, 2 - front scanner only

Since the detection scanner is normally also used for navigation, the scan data should be more extensively used.

I,scan_pef_use_nth_meas, 2 to maximize the scan points for positioning

In this mode the detection data is used internally for controlling the vehicle to the target marked with the reflectors. The extensive detection data is not output to the PLC.

The scanner calibration is done as in the pallet detection case.

The detection range is approximately as below

Obstacle Detection

Updated 26.01.2024

Introduction

Obstacle detection feature detects the obstacles in a predefined area around the AGV and outputs them as a list of lines. The detected obstacles does not affect driving in any way, so the AGV will not slow down, stop, or try to avoid those obstacles.

Obstacle detection feature is most commonly used with positioning only AGV systems and in AGV systems that have their own external obstacle avoidance logic implemented.

This feature should not be confused with the "Obstacle Avoidance" feature, which is capable to stop the AGV before detected obstacles and plan routes around them. In case you are interested in those functionalities check "Navitrol - Obstacle Avoidance" document.

Setting Up and Navitrol Parameters

This feature requires

  • "obstacle avoidance"-license, so please order that it to enable obstacle detection.
  • The ethernet supervisor interface with messages 3049 and 3149 implemented

In Navitrol, add and adjust the following parameters to enable and fine tune the feature:

ParametersDescription
I, obst_detection_mode, 1Enable obstacle detection:
0 = disabled
1 = enabled
I, obst_detection_scanners, 3Defines which localization scanners are used for obstacle detection:
0 = none
1 = rear scanner only
2 = front scanner only
3 = both scanners
I, obst_detection_meas_scanners, 0Defines which measurement scanners are used for obstacle detection:
0 = none
1 = first scanner only
2 = second scanner only
3 = both scanners
F,obst_detection_max_dist_in_object, 0.20Maximum distance between scan points for them to be considered the same detected object.
For example, in this case if there are two scan point clusters that are more than 20 cm apart, they will be considered two separate objects, so separate lines will be detected for each
F, obst_detection_max_dist_from_line, 0.05Maximum distance a scan point can have from the detected line. This means that there will be a scan point in the detected area maximum this much away from detected lines.
I, log_obst_detectionLog obstacle detection, 0 - none, 1 - result line counts, 2 - detailed logging, 3- log all lines
It is recommended to set this value to 2 when starting to use the feature and to 3 if there is any issues. Otherwise it can be kept disabled with 0 value.

Once these parameters are set, the predefined obstacle detection area can be defined as explained in Chapter 3, and the detected lines will be provided in the format explained in Chapter 4.

Obstacle Detection Area

The obstacle detection area is defined in the AGV coordinate system as a partial circle. This area should be provided by defining its radius, starting angle and end angle using the "Ethernet supervisor interface". Starting and ending angles should be defined in degrees between -180 and 180, such that directly in front of the AGV is considered 0 degrees, and counter-clockwise angles are positive. A representation of this convention can be seen in the figure below.

If it the AGV should detect obstacles in all angles within the radius, the starting angle should be set to -180 and the end angle should be 180 degrees. Conversely, to not detect any obstacles, the radius can be set to 0 meters.

For example, in the picture above, the radius is 3 meters, starting angle is -60 degrees and end angle is 60 degrees.

Conversely, in the picture above, starting angle is 60 degrees while end angle is -60 degrees.

The obstacle detection area can be defined with the message 3049 from supervisor. Please see the ethernet communication document for the expected format of the message.

Detected Obstacle Lines

Navitrol will provide obstacles in form of lines, that are defined by starting point coordinates and end point coordinates. The detected lines will also be visualized in Navitrol Monitor as black lines, as visualized in the figure below:

All scanner points that are in the detected area will be at most "obst_detection_max_dist_from_line" away from one of the lines. In case a single point is detected that could not be in any of the lines, it will be given as a line with the same starting and end point.

The detected lines will be reported to the supervisor with the message 3149. Please see the ethernet communications document for the format of the message.

External Target Detection

Updated 26.07.2024

Introduction

External target detection stands for a target detection feature where Navitrol receives target X,Y and heading difference to the target and external sensor detects this target. Thus, Navitrol does not do target detection itself, Navitrol only receives the position of the desired target from external target detection system.

This external target detection system can be whatever (meaning laser scanner, camera, ultrasound sensor etc) as long as it can produce X.Y and heading difference information of the target to Navitrol.

Functionality

For the external target detection, Navitrol will send this information:

  1. When to start detection of the target, based on requirements below:

    • Normal Pickup symbolic point

      • The maximum angle between the camera and symbolic point before starting the detection.
      • Distance to the symbolic point before starting the detection.

    • Racking

      • When AGV is close to the shelf and actuator is lifted to the shelf height, but AGV has not yet driven in to the shelf.

    • Buffer lanes

      • AGV is inside buffer area + buffer_check_start_dist_offset_m.

  2. X, Y, Z and angle difference to the assumed target position (symbolic point) with respect to the sensor in AGV coordinates. With this external target detection system can define the area where to search the target (pallet width + max allowed position error).

  3. Information if target is detected too far away from the route/symbolic point.

Navitrol receives target position difference and target locked information. In addition, Error code and Device type fields to the message (message 3035 external target detection request)

Navitrol has to receive the position information of the target from the external target detection system:

  1. dX and dY With respect to the sensor in sensor coordinate as frame as defined in Navitrol (values dX and dY)

  2. Heading H as the target heading with respect to the sensor heading. (H target heading is 90 degrees in this picture)

Buffer lanes

  • AGV start requesting detection as soon as it is inside the buffer area + buffer_check_start_dist_offset_m.
  • The initial target position is the symbolic point, but the once the target is found the target position is updated to the detected target position. The target height (Z) is 0.
  • Can be configured in a way that AGV waits only one result or update within specified interval. See ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms parameter below.
  • AGV does not stop for detection.
  • Pickup: If no target result received until the end of the buffer, Navitrol will trigger WARNING_TARGET_APPROACH_ERROR.
  • Dropoff: If no target result received until the end of the buffer, Navitrol will perform dropoff on top of symbolic point.

Racking

  • AGV start requesting detection when it is close to the shelf and actuator is lifted to the shelf height, but AGV has not yet driven in to the shelf.
    • The assumed target position is the symbolic point, the target height (Z) is the shelf height.
  • Should be configured in a way that AGV waits only one result. ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms parameter as 0.
    • AGV continues driving and docks to the target once target position is received
    • If no target result is received within 3 seconds or received target is too far from the symbolic point, ERROR_PALLET_DET_FAILURE error is set. See Racking document for more info.

Stacking

  • AGV start requesting detection as soon as it is inside the buffer area + buffer_check_start_dist_offset_m.
  • The initial target position is the symbolic point, but once the target is found the target position is updated to the detected target position. The target height (Z) is the estimated height. See ext_target_det_height_mode parameter.
  • Can be configured in a way that AGV waits only one result or update within specified interval. See ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms parameter below.
  • AGV does not stop for detection.
  • When target position is received, Navitrol will stop in front of the stack and move the actuator to estimated height that is given with a drive order from fleet control.
  • New target detection is requested and target Z is needed to tell the target height for the actuator.
  • If target detection is not received within block_stacking_max_detection_wait_time_ms,
    • On Pickup, ERROR_PALLET_POCKET_NOT_FOUND is set.
    • On Dropoff, dropoff is performed to the ground if there is space on the buffer lane or if buffer is full, AGV waits for new drive order.
  • If target detection is received, Navitrol will control the actuator to the specified height and will continue driving to stack for pickup or dropoff.
  • See Pickup from stack and Dropoff to stack documents for more info.

Mode

There are two possible modes for external target detection.

  1. Navitrol expects detection results within ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms timer when detection is requested. If detection result is coming later than this parameter, detection is not requested.
  2. Navitrol expects only one detection result. This can be activated with ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms as 0. Navitrol request detection until it has received the result. Error is set if response is not received in time. See ext_target_det_response_timeout_ms parameter.

Parameters

These parameters must be set to params.txt file when external target detection is used. For more information on docking, see Docking.

ParameterDescription
I,target_detection_type_selection, 44 = external target detection. This parameter activates external target detection feature.
F,target_detection_max_dist_to_symbolic_point, 6.0Max distance to the symbolic point to start sending "start observing" signal to the external target detection sensor
I,docking_to_target_enabled, 11 = Enables docking to target.
2 = **not supported with external target detection
F,docking_max_start_distance, 3.5Beyond maximum distance docking won't be triggered
F,docking_max_start_angle, 20.000000Max angle difference from navigation point to the target compared to tarjectory's end point's heading, when starting to dock [+-degrees fov]
F,docking_max_start_heading, 45.000000Max angle diff for vehicle heading and trajectory's end point heading, when starting to dock [+-degrees fov]
F,ext_target_det_sensor_x_pos, 0.0External target detection sensor x position with respect to the AGV navigation point. Positive towards front of the vehicle
F,ext_target_det_sensor_y_pos, 0.0External target detection sensor y position with respect to the AGV navigation point. Positive to the left side of the vehicle
F,ext_target_det_sensor_angle_deg, 0.0External target detection sensor heading with respect to the AGV heading.
I,ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms, 500External target detection data is sent to supervisor every second when target is not detected. This parameter defines the update interval when target detection is activated. Maximum value 900 ms. 0 = Expect target detection only once when requested.
I,ext_target_det_measurement_delay_ms, 50Delay of sensor measurement in ms relative to AGV position measurements. Maximum value 300 milliseconds
F,ext_target_min_dist_from_traj_end_to_nav_point, 0.40Minimum distance from navigation point to trajectory end that target position is still updated
F,ext_target_det_target_rendering_width, 0.9External target detection target width when rendered to NavitrolMonitor. Does not affect to any calculations.
F,ext_target_det_target_rendering_length, 0.4External target detection target width when rendered to Monitor. Does not affect to any calculations.
I,ext_target_det_height_mode, 00 = External target detection z value is used as reference height for actuator. E.g. z = 0.9m, actuator reference will be 900mm.
1 = z value is in sensor coordinates. E.g. value 0.2m would lift actuator 200mm from its current height.
U, log_ext_target_det, 0Enables logging of external target detection data. 0 - disabled, 1 - enabled
I,ext_target_det_response_timeout_ms, 2000Time to wait [ms] for target detection response. Error is set if Navitrol doesn't receive response within this time. If set to 0, error is never set. Only used when ext_target_det_sensor_update_rate_ms is 0.

Supervisor interface configuration

3135 -- External target detection request

Navitrol sends this message periodically to the Supervisor/PLC for external target detection. The sending interval is 1 Hz while the target detection is inactive. When the target detection is active, the sending interval is according to a parameter. The parameter value shall be set according to the sensor update rate. Target searching is activated at a certain distance to the symbolic point and deactivated again when the target is reached or when the target finding fails because of too short remaining distance to the symbolic point.

Data fieldTypeLength (bytes)Comment
Protocol Version = 4Unsigned Short2Navitrol ethernet protocol version
Message ID = 3135Unsigned Short2
Message length = 28Unsigned Integer4Message length in bytes including all data fields (including Protocol Version and Message ID)
Start detectionUnsigned Short21 - Start detecting the target
0 - Stop detecting
Assumed target position X differenceFloat4Distance from sensor position along the centre line of the detection sensor view.
Assumed target position Y differenceFloat4Distance from sensor position perpendicular to the center line of the detection sensor view.
Positive to the left.
Assumed target position Z differenceFloat4Distance from sensor position in vertical direction.
Positive direction upwards.
Value forced to 0
Assumed target angle differenceFloat4Angle of the target with respect to the X-axis.
Positive in CCW direction.
Detection too far from routeUnsigned short21 = target detected too far away.
Otherwise, value is 0

3035 -- External target detection response

The supervisor replies to the detection request from Navitrol with target found information and target x, y, z and angle. Additionally, the Supervisor sends the error code if the sensor goes into error state.

Data fieldTypeLength (bytes)Comment
Protocol Version = 4Unsigned Short2Navitrol ethernet protocol version
Message ID = 3035Unsigned Short2
Message length = 38Unsigned Integer4Message length in bytes including all data fields (including Protocol Version and Message ID)
Target X difference from sensorFloat4X is the center line of the detection sensor view
Target Y difference from sensorFloat4Y to the left from sensor X-axis
Target Z difference from sensorFloat4Z is in vertical direction.
Positive direction upwards.
Value forced to 0
Target angle difference between sensor heading and target headingFloat40 along sensor X-axis, positive in CCW direction
Target foundUnsigned short20 = target not found
1 = target found
Error codeUnsigned integer4Device error code number
Value 0 = no errors
Reserved bytesInteger4Value forced to 0
Reserved bytesInteger4Value forced to 0

Troubleshooting

To enable more extensive logging set parameter U, log_ext_target_det, 1. The logging has prefix "ExtTarDet:".

Different errors related to external target detection can be found from Error Descriptions document.

Table detection

Updated 21.03.2024

Overview

Introduction

The table detection feature can be used to accurately dock under a table in situations where static environment is scarce or occluded by the table legs.

The initial location of the table is detected using the pallet detection feature but further positioning and docking is done based on the table legs instead of the static environment. This ensures increased docking accuracy compared to pure pallet detection. For more information on docking, see Docking.

Requirements

For the table detection feature to work following requirements must be met:

  • Pallet detection v2 set up so that the table can be detected
    • See Navitrol - Pallet Detection Instructions document for more information.
    • Note: requires pallet detection license
  • The scanners must be
    • Calibrated
    • Properly placed so that the table legs are visible during the entire docking procedure. See Figure on clustering of table legs

Limitations

  • The table must have four legs

Dependencies

Requires that Pallet detection v2 is active so other target detection features cannot be used simultaneously.

How to use

The AGV detects the table using pallet detection v2 as normally, and automatically continues detection using this feature once the target is locked, if the feature is enabled. The detection continues inside the table. The pose of the table is estimated most accurately when both the front and rear legs are detected, but will also work when only the rear legs are detected. Each cluster, in this case leg, will provide two geometric centroids, a centre point (x,y) coordinate for the vertical and horizontal segments, totalling 8 centroids in total at maximum for the table. The centroid are used to estimate the table pose. A centroid in this context refers to the centre of mass for the scanner points. The pallet is visible as a green rectangle in the Monitor.

Set up

ParameterRecommended valueDescription
I,pallet_det_2_relative_target_det_after_locking1Enable the table detection by setting to 1
F,pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_width0.1Width margin for clustering polygons, visualized in Figure below
F,pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_length0.1Length margin for clustering polygons, visualized in Figure below
I, log_table_detection1Enable detailed logging mode by setting to 1

The clustering of the table legs is done based on the locked pose and target model, obtained from pallet detection v2. The clusters are centered around the geometric centre point of the leg. All points inside the polygons, in the Figure below seen as orange rectangles, are clustered together.

Clustering of table legs. The orange rectangles are the polygons, the black rectangles is the table and its legs, and the grey rectangle is the AGV.

The size of the clusters is determined by parameters:
pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_length
pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_width
pallet_model_side_leg_length_x
pallet_model_side_leg_width_y

The assumption is that the table has four legs and that at least 8 scanner points are detected per horizontal and vertical side of the table leg. This is dependent on the distance to legs and the resolution of the scanner(s). The clusters are filtered based on distance and angle, to create vertical and horizontal segments of each cluster.

Fine tuning

The larger the margins, the bigger the risk of false positives, as surrounding scanner points might be clustered to one table leg. However, if the margins are too small, the table legs might not be clustered if the AGV pose drifts. The default values are recommended, however, in the event that the AGV pose drift is larger the margins can be increased. If the AGV pose drift is normally small during docking and the tables are close to each other, decreasing the margins is recommended to prevent clustering neighbouring table legs.

Troubleshooting

The target docking pose is too sensitive to AGV pose fluctuations

Decrease target_detection_results_dampening. The aforementioned parameter is used to compute the average pose of several measurements.

The target docking pose is not sensitive enough to AGV pose fluctuations

Increase target_detection_results_dampening

Advanced troubleshooting

Read this section for help with troubleshooting, if the table has been detected by pallet detection v2 and the docking target has been locked, but the docking target does not update continuosly.

The centroids are logged in map coordinates as Table detection - centroids, the validity of the centroids are logged with prefix Table detection - flv.

AbbrevationExplanation
flvfront left vertical segment
frvfront right vertical segment
rlvrear left vertical segment
rlhrear left horizontal segment
rrvrear right vertical segment
rrhrear right horizontal segment

Centroid logging abbreviations

The logging for this feature has prefix Table detection.

If the deviation from last computed table pose is less than pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_width and pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_length the pose is valid, and the following will be logged:
Table detection pose valid

The estimated table pose in global coordinates is logged as:
Table detection pose [map coord], providing the x,y,h (degrees) pose of the table.

The centroids are found, but do not conform with scanner data for legs

Decrease or increase the polygon margins (pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_width/length), depending on the initial values

The centroids are invalid and a pose estimate is not obtained

Increase the polygon margins (pallet_det_polygon_cluster_margin_width/length)

Wall monitoring

Updated 26.01.2024

Overview

Introduction

The wall monitoring feature is used for obstacle detection. A slowdown or stop trigger is activated if the AGV's frame is at a certain distance from the obstacle. For obstacle avoidance, see document Obstacle avoidance.

Limitations

  • Not a safety feature
  • Only applicable to position control machine types
  • Maximum two scanners
  • The AGV frame dimensions cannot be smaller than the difference between slow and stop distance

How to use

All valid scanner points at a distance larger than wallmon_min_scan_dist are evaluated for wall monitoring. The AGV frame is extrapolated in the current AGV frame direction in increments of wallmon_pred_ds. The AGV frame is defined by parameters dim_rear, dim_front, dim_left, dim_right and wallmon_pred_safety_margin. See Figure below. If more points than wallmon_min_hits occupy the AGV frame, the AGV will either slow down or stop depending on the distance to the obstacle.

The AGV frame used for wall monitoring. The black dashed rectangle visualizes the complete AGV frame including the margin.

Set up

Quick start

Required parameters

ParameterRecommended valueDescription
I, wallmon_enabled1Enables wall monitor feature that can be used to stop the AGV based on detected nearby objects.
F, wallmon_slow_dist0.4Slow down if scan points are detected closer than this
F, wallmon_stop_dist0.1Stop if scan points are detected closer than this.

Fine-tuning

Optional parameters

ParameterRecommended valueDescription
F, wallmon_stop_manual_speed0.0Control speed that is used instead of stopping when soft stop, hard stop or emergency stop is active during manual mode.
F, wallmon_pred_ds0.01Step size for wall monitor collision prediction in meters. Lower value takes more processing time but is more accurate.
F, wallmon_pred_safety_margin0.05How close to the AGV's predicted frame the scans must be to trigger slow or stop.
I, wallmon_min_hits3Minimum scanner measurement hits required within wall monitor's stop and slow safety areas to trigger slow or stop.
F, wallmon_min_scan_dist0.01Scanner measurements from shorter distances [m] than this are ignored. Can be used to avoid false positives caused by noise.

Troubleshooting

Advanced troubleshooting

All related logging is under prefix "Wallmon".

Occupancy check

Updated 26.01.2024

Overview

Introduction

Occupancy check is a feature for detecting with laser scanners if an area is occupied and preventing the AGV from driving there. The area is linked to a symbolic point. The occupancy of the area is checked when the AGV is driving towards the symbolic point on the AGV's path. The AGV is stopped waiting in front of the symbolic point in Auto state if the area is occupied. The AGV continues to drive towards the symbolic point when the area becomes free again.

Requirements

  • Navitrol 6.24.00 or later
  • NavithorTools
  • Scanner position and heading is calibrated, see Initial calibration guide

Limitations

  • Supports 2D laser scanners only
  • Occupancy check is based on number of scanner beam hits inside of the occupancy check area. No filtering or pattern detection is applied.
  • The feature can be used to prevent AGV from driving into area where a collision might happen but it is not a safety system.

Set up

Quick start

  • Create a route that has symbolic point in Navithor Tools
  • Enable occupancy check for the symbolic point and modify the area polygon if needed
  • Upload the area to the AGV
  • Enable occupancy check with Navitrol parameters occup_check_enabled, 1
  • Select which scanners are used for the occupancy check with occup_check_scan_selection (value 15 will use all possible scanners)
  • Place an object inside the occupancy area
  • Give a drive order to the symbolic point
  • AGV should stop before reaching the symbolic point and raise a warning WARNING_SYMBOL_POINT_OCCUPIED

Required parameters

NameTypeRequired valueDescription
occup_check_enabledInt1Enables occupancy check around symbolic point. AGV stops if it detects that zone linked to symbolic point is occupied.

Other parameters

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
occup_check_start_distFloat3.0Distance [m] to symbolic point to trigger occupancy check. Measured from the front or rear of the vehicle depending of driving direction.
occup_check_stop_distFloat0.2Distance [m] to symbolic point to stop checking occupancy.
occup_check_min_hitsInt1Minimum hits required in occupancy area to stop the vehicle.
occup_check_min_hits_modeInt1Defines mode how the laser hits from assigned scanners are compared to the occup_check_min_hits threshold which sets the occupancy of the area: 1 = Sum of hits from all assigned scanners are equal or above threshold, 2 = Hits from at least one assigned scanner are equal or above threshold, 3 = Hits from each and every assigned scanner are equal or above threshold.
occup_check_scan_selectionInt1Defines which scanners are used for occupancy check: Bit 0 = rear scanner, Bit 1 = front scanner, Bit 2 = measurement 0 scanner, Bit 3 = measurement 1 scanner. For example to use rear and front scanner, set value to 3 (0011)
occup_check_modeInt0Occupancy check mode: 0 = check always, 1 = disable when AGV is not carrying a load, 2 = disable when AGV carries a load, 3 = disable for a Pick up symbolic point when AGV is not carrying a load.

How to use

Navithor Tools

There can be one Occupancy area defined for one symbolic point. The area is a polygon which size, number of vertices and position can be edited after clicking the settings button on the right side of the Enable occupancy check text. The symbolic point is not required to be inside the area. There can be also multiple symbolic points that have occupancy check enabled on the path that AGV is driving.

Configure

When occupancy is checked

Occupancy check is active for a defined distance range before the symbolic point. The distance range can be modified using parameters occup_check_start_dist and occup_check_stop_dist. The distances are measured from the front or rear of the AGV depending on the driving direction. Note that it is Euclidean distance and not distance along the path. Image below shows how the distance is measured when AGV is driving forwards to the symbolic point. Occupancy check can not be activated after the AGV has passed the symbolic point.

Determining the occupancy of the area

The occupancy of the area is determined by the number of 2D laser scanner beam hits inside the area. When there are equal or more hits inside the area than the threshold occup_check_min_hits, the area is occupied. With occup_check_min_hits_mode, the user can configure the way the laser scanner beam hits are calculated from the different scanners. There are three different modes:

  1. Sum of hits from all assigned scanners are equal or above threshold
Assigned scanners: Rear and Front
occup_check_min_hits = 10
Number of hits:
Rear = 4, Front = 5, Total = 9 (Area not occupied)
Rear = 4, Front = 6, Total = 10 (Area is occupied)
  1. Hits from at least one assigned scanner are equal or above threshold
Assigned scanners: Rear and Front
occup_check_min_hits = 10
Number of hits:
Rear = 4, Front = 7, (Area not occupied)
Rear = 10, Front = 1 (Area is occupied)
  1. Hits from each and every assigned scanner are equal or above threshold
Assigned scanners: Rear and Front
occup_check_min_hits = 10
Number of hits:
Rear = 10, Front = 7, (Area is not occupied)
Rear = 10, Front = 10 (Area is occupied)

Selecting the scanners for the occupancy check

There are up to four scanners that can be assigned for the occupancy check. Rear scanner, front scanner and two measurement scanners. These can be configured freely with occup_check_scan_selection parameter. Note that the parameter value is a bitfield.
Parameter value examples: | Parameter value | Binary | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | 0001 | Bit0 = Only Rear scanner | | 2 | 0010 | Bit1 = Only Front scanner | | 3 | 0011 | Bit0 & Bit1 = Rear and Front scanners | | 4 | 0100 | Bit2 = Only Measurement 0 scanner | | ... | | 15 | 1111 | All four scanners are assigned |

Disable occupancy check based on the AGV's load status

Occupancy check can be configured to be disabled based on the AGV's load status. For example if occupancy of an area should not be checked when AGV is not carrying a load, disable by setting occup_check_mode to 1. Disable occupancy check when AGV is carrying a load by setting the parameter to 2. The mode 3 is targeted for empty space detection in a pick up / drop off symbolic point. Idea is that when AGV goes to pick up the load, occupancy check is disabled.

Troubleshooting

Common issues

AGV does not stop even if there is obstacle in the area

  • Verify that the correct scanners are selected for the occupancy check occup_check_scan_selection. The default value of 1 (Bit 0) defines that only rear scanner is used for the occupancy check.

Warning

620 - WARNING_SYMBOL_POINT_OCCUPIED

This warning is raised when AGV has stopped due to occupancy of the area. When the area is cleared, the warning is reset and the AGV is allowed to continue its current drive. If the area can not be cleared from obstacles, the warning can be reset by aborting the current drive which also puts the AGV from Auto state to Standby state.

Error Descriptions

Updated 10.09.2024

Error Classification

Navitrol errors are classified into three categories

  • Fatal errors
  • Errors
  • Warnings

Fatal errors and errors stop automatic operation of Navitrol. Depending on the error in question, manual driving using Navitrol may still be possible. Fatal errors differ from normal errors so that they have to be acknowledged by the user before they are cleared. Some fatal errors can't be acknowledged and require Navitrol restart. Fatal errors can be divided into following three categories:

  • Only manual driving is allowed, user acknowledgement is required.
  • No driving is allowed, user acknowledgement is required.
  • No driving is allowed, can't be acknowledged at run time. Navitrol restart is required.

Warnings are set as a notification only. Navitrol operation (like automatic driving) is not stopped in case of a warning. Depending on the warning in question, Navitrol operation can be affected though. Therefore, one should always figure out why a specific warning is set and what it means from Navitrol functional point of view.

Overriding Severity Levels

It is possible to raise the severity level of errors and warnings. In other words, the severity level of Error can be increased to Fatal error, and Warning can be increased to either Error or Fatal error.

To override the severity level of an error or a warning, we need to specify its id and the new severity level. The error/warning id is the numeric value mentioned at the beginning of the title of each errors/warnings (e.g., the error id of ERROR_SCANNER_PROTOCOL_ERROR is 101).

Parameters

NameTypeDefault valueDescription
error_override_id[0...9]Int-1The error or warning id that its severity level needs to be overridden (-1 means no error id).
error_override_level[0...9]Int0New severity level:
0: default severity level
1: warning
2: error
3: fatal error

General Critical Errors

101 ERROR_SCANNER_PROTOCOL_ERROR

Description: Sick S300 scanner protocol differs from 1.2 or 1.3

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol communicates with SICK S300. The scanner reports a communication protocol that is unknown to Navitrol.

How to recover: Contact a system specialists at Navitec or SICK.

102 ERROR_MAP_FILE_READ

Description: The map file could not be read

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Something is wrong in the map file (.nte) in the /home/navitec folder. Navitrol is not able to read the file. The file may be corrupted.

How to recover: Try to transfer a new map file to Navitrol. If it does not help contact Navitec.

103 ERROR_MULTIPLE_MAPS_PER_FLOOR

Description: More than one map is found for a floor

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: There are several map files for the same floor in the /home/navitec folder. Navitrol can only have one map file for each floor.

How to recover: Check the files in the /home/navitec folder. Remove the wrong files.

104 ERROR_TOO_MANY_MAP_FILES

Description: More than supported number of map files

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: There are more than 200 map files for more than 200 floors in the Navitrol folder.

How to recover: Check the files in the /home/navitec folder. Remove the wrong files.

105 ERROR_PARAM_PARSE

Description: Error parsing parameter file

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The parameter file params.txt in the /home/navitec folder is not OK. The file may be corrupted, it may have typing errors (even invisible characters) or wrong number of parameters.

How to recover: Check the error prints in the startlog.txt file. Navitrol tells what is wrong with the parameter file.

106 ERROR_NO_LICENSE_CODE

Description: The license key is invalid

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: There is no valid license key in the Navitrol IPC.

How to recover: Retrieve a new license key from the Navitrol License Server or contact Navitec.

107 ERROR_THREAD_NON_RESPONSIVE

Description: One or more of the monitored threads in SW is not responsive enough.

Error Level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: CPU overload.

How to recover: SW recovers from this ERROR by itself. This ERROR should be quite exceptional. If it happens though, take a log and contact Navitec for finding a reason for the error.

108 ERROR_DRIVE_CONFIG

Description: Error in drive motor configuration.

Error Level: Fatal Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Error in drive motor configuration - like parameters related to drive input/output inversion or scaling.

How to recover: Check and fix all driving related configuration parameters. If reason is not resolved, take a log and contact Navitec.

109 ERROR_STEER_ANGLE_CONFIG

Description: Error in steer angle configuration

Error level: Fatal error

Machine types: Steer

Error reason: Parameters related to input/output inversion or scaling wrong. Steer angle has deviated from the target longer than mot_ctrl_drive_angle_diag_time_ms

How to recover: Check and fix all steering related configuration parameters. If reason is not resolved, take a log and contact Navitec.

110 ERROR_ODOMETRY_SOURCE

Description: This error indicates that the odometry source is not defined preventing Navitrol from positioning.

Error level: Fatal error - requires restart after parameter values have been checked and fixed.

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Parameter odometry_source has not been properly defined.

How to recover: Check and fix related configuration parameter odometry_source.

111 ERROR_PARAMETER_RECONFIGURE_NEEDED

Description: This error indicates that reconfiguration of some parameter file is needed, because parameters used for some specific purpose have changed, and parameter files need to be modified accordingly. This error may be triggered by an issue in any of the parameter files used by Navitrol. Issues triggering this error are rather complex in nature, and are typically related to Navitrol SW updates.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Some parameter values need to be redefined or parameter used for some specific thing needs to be changed.

How to recover: Run command .\Navitrol paramreconfigure. This command gives detailed information about changes needed. It can even fix the parameter file(s) automatically in many cases, if given a permission to do so.

General Errors

201 ERROR_VEH_INTE_MSG_PARSE

Description: message parsing error in the vehicle interface

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: This error is triggered when a message from the Ethernet interface cannot be parsed correctly.

How to recover: The error is automatically gone when a correct message is received. This error should however never happen. Please check the messages that are sent to Navitrol. There is most likely something wrong in the message contents.

202 ERROR_SCANNER_MSG_PARSE

Description: Scanner message parsing error

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The message received from the scanner cannot be parsed. There is something wrong with the data.

How to recover: This error should not happen. In case of serial interface check that the cables are ok. Otherwise contact Navitec.

203 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_FRONT_SCANNER

Description: front scanner hasn't received scans

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the front scanner

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

204 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_REAR_SCANNER

Description: rear scanner hasn't received scans

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the rear scanner

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

205 ERROR_MEAS_CNT_MISMATCH_FRONT

Description: A measurement in a single scan does not contain expected number of measurements, check the configuration of the rear scanner.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The Sick S300 scanner has wrong configuration

How to recover: Change the scanner configuration with the SICK CDS software

206 ERROR_MEAS_CNT_MISMATCH_REAR

Description: A measurement in a single scan does not contain expected number of measurements, check the configuration of the rear scanner

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The Sick S300 scanner has wrong configuration

How to recover: Change the scanner configuration with the SICK CDS software

207 ERROR_POSITION_CONFIDENCE_LOW

Description: The position confidence is too low

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has lost the position confidence. There can be several reasons for this, including: The scanner view is blocked, bad scanner or vehicle kinematics calibration, bad environment model, slipping of the wheels, positioning parameters are not correct for the environment, etc.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec for finding a reason for the error. Initialize the position to continue.

208 ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_REF_DET

Description: Not enough reflectors detected

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: If the Navitrol parameter min_reflectors_seen is set to a higher value than 0, this error is triggered when less reflectors than the value of the parameter are detected.

How to recover: Check that the parameter value min_reflectors_seen is making sense in relation to the amount of reflectors that should be visible. Add more reflectors if needed or change the parameter value.

209 ERROR_POSITION_NOT_INITIALIZED

Description: The position hasn't been initialized

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The position has not been initialized and the parameter require_position_initialization is set to 1.

How to recover: Initialize position again.

210 ERROR_LOCALIZE_NOT_READY

Description: The localization task is not ready

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The localize task is not ready to do its work. It may be starting or it is reading in files or Navitrol is shutting down.

How to recover: In case of startup this failure disappears automatically. If this error stays on, take a log and contact Navitec.

211 ERROR_DEADREC_HIGH_DT

Description: Too long since last deadrec update

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received a dead reckoning message from the vehicle controller for a time longer than the parameter odo_max_interval_ms.

How to recover: Check the message sending interval from the vehicle controller. Adjust the parameter or fix the message sending.

212 ERROR_POSCONT_HIGH_DT

Description: Too long since last position control update

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: No position controller update for a time longer than the parameter poscont_max_interval_ms. For some reason the poscont task does not run normally.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

213 ERROR_SCANNER_FRONT_HIGH_DT

Description: The intervals between received laser scans from the front scanner is too high

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner measurement messages are not received for a time exceeding the parameter scan_max_dt_err_ms.

How to recover: Check the cables, front scanner and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

214 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_SAFETY_SCANNER

Description: No scans have been received from the safety scanner

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the safety scanner

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

215 ERROR_MEAS_CNT_MISMATCH_SAFETY

Description: A measurement in a single scan does not contain expected number of measurements, check the configuration of the safety scanners

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The Sick S300 scanner has wrong configuration

How to recover: Change the scanner configuration with the SICK CDS software

216 ERROR_ENC_DATA

Description: Invalid encoder data

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The received encoder data is out of range

How to recover: Take a log and send to Navitec

217 ERROR_LICENSE_OPTION_MISSING

Description: The current license doesn't include permission to use a feature that is being activated

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: A feature requiring an additional license is enabled in the params.txt file without the corresponding license.

How to recover: Take a log and send to Navitec.

218 ERROR_POS_INI_NOT_ENOUGH_REF_DET

Description: Not enough reflectors detected during position initialization

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Fewer reflectors than the parameter pos_ini_min_reflectors_seen are detected during position initialization. If the parameter pos_ini_min_reflectors_seen is 0 no reflectors are needed

How to recover: Make sure that enough reflectors are visible when initializing position or change the parameter value.

219 ERROR_CONFIG_PARAMETER_VALUE

Description: Incorrect parameter value in verification

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: A parameter is set to incorrect value.

How to recover: The incorrect parameter can be seen in the Navitrol text log file. Check the log file, or send it to Navitec.

220 ERROR_POS_INI_NOT_ENOUGH_REF_DET_DRIV

Description: Not enough reflectors detected during position initialization while driving

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The vehicle doesn't see the specified number of reflectors during a specified distance after position initialization. The number of reflectors and the distance are specified using Navitrol parameters.

How to recover: Reinitialize the position and make sure the machine sees enough reflectors.

221 ERROR_NO_DATA_FROM_EXT_LOC_SENSOR

Description: No data received from external localization sensor

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received data from the external localization sensor

How to recover: Check the cables, the external sensor and computer. In case of Ethernet communication other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

222 ERROR_EXT_LOC_SENSOR_MSG_PARSE

Description: Parsing error of message from external localization sensor

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The message received from the localization sensor cannot be parsed. There is something wrong with the data.

How to recover: This error should not happen. In case of serial interface check that cables are ok. Otherwise take a log and contact Navitec.

223 ERROR_EXT_LOC_TOO_LONG_SINCE_MEASUREMENT

Description: Too long time since a message has been received from the external localization sensor

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The sensor is not switched on, the sensors' communication is not initiated or the cables are not connected.

How to recover: Check that the sensor is on and its' cables are connected. Re-initialize the sensor communication by activating it from the master unit or restarting the master unit. Take a log and contact Navitec.

224 ERROR_SCANNER_REAR_HIGH_DT

Description: The interval between received laser scans from the rear scanner is too high

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner measurement messages have not been received for a time exceeding the parameter scan_max_dt_err_ms.

How to recover: Check the cables, rear scanner and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

225 ERROR_NO_DATA_FROM_LINE_FOLLOWING_SENSOR

Description: No data has been received from the line following sensor

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: No line following data has been received via ethernet UDP

How to recover: Check connection and cables

226 ERROR_MSG_PARSE_LINE_FOLLOWING_SENSOR

Description: Error parsing line following sensor message

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Line following data parsed either via CAN or ethernet is invalid

How to recover: Check connection and cables, if message is sent via ethernet check that the sending counter is valid

227 ERROR_LINE_FOLLOWING_NO_MEASUREMENT

Description: No measurement received from sensor

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: AGV is driving on a route with line following tag without detecting the line for a distance of parameter line_following_max_dist_since_last_meas, from either front or rear sensor

How to recover: If the sensors are theoretically on the route and should detect the line, check connection and verify everything is ok. Error is reset by driving manually or disabling parameter line_following_sensor_communication.

228 ERROR_LICENSE_FILE

Description: License file missing or invalid - missing or conflicting data in license file.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: License file 'LicenseDetails.json' in subfolder "license" is missing or corrupted.

How to recover: This error is not recoverable. It requires fixing the issue and then restarting Navitrol. Send 'startlog.txt' and license file (if exists) to Navitec support.

229 ERROR_LICENSE_CONTENT

Description: License file conflicting with the License content or License content inconsistent.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: License content has inconsistent information. Possible reasons are

  • Corrupted license file 'LicenseDetails.json' in subfolder "license".
  • When updating/upgrading license, either license file or License has not been truly updated.

How to recover: This error is not recoverable. It requires fixing the issue and then restarting Navitrol. Send 'startlog.txt' and license file ('LicenseDetails.json' in subfolder "license") to Navitec support.

230 ERROR_TEST_VERSION_TIME_LIMIT_REACHED

Description: Test version time limit has been reached. You can continue testing by restarting Navitrol.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Test versions are meant for testing purposes only, and therefore the run time has been limited.

How to recover: This error is not recoverable. Navitrol can be restarted to restart the test time. When feature being tested has been verified to work ok, request for updated non-test version of Navitrol.

General Warnings

300 WARNING_UNAUTHORIZED_SETTING

Description: Unauthorized parameter setting

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Unauthorized parameter setting

How to recover: Contact Navitec

302 WARNING_TOO_MANY_LOG_FILES

Description: there are too many log files in the logs -directory, the oldest was overwritten

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Too many log files

How to recover: No need to do anything, this warning is just informative

303 WARNING_LOG_DUMP

Description: log dump failed

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol is not able to save the log file

How to recover: Clean the /home/navitec/logs folder. Reboot the system, contact Navitec.

304 WARNING_NOT_ENOUGH_FREE_SPACE

Description: Not enough free disk space

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: There is less free hard drive space than the parameter min_free_disk_space_mb.

How to recover: Check the following subfolders located under Navitrol "home" (defaults to /home/navitec) folder: /logs, /old, /params_backup, /teach. Remove unnecessary old files and reboot the system. If that does not help, contact Navitec.

305 WARNING_TEACHING_ALREADY_ON

Description: teaching is already on

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: A new command to start teaching is received when Navitrol is already in teaching mode

How to recover: Recovers automatically, no need to do anything

306 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_PROTECTION_ZONE

Description: The front laser scanner protection zone is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The front scanner sees something inside the protection zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the protection zone is not triggered.

307 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_PROTECTION_ZONE

Description: The rear laser scanner protection zone is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The rear scanner sees something inside the protection zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the protection zone is not triggered.

308 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE1

Description: The front laser scanner warning zone 1 is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The front scanner sees something inside the first warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the warning zone is not triggered.

309 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE1

Description: The rear laser scanner warning zone 1 is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The rear scanner sees something inside the first warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the warning zone is not triggered.

310 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE2

Description: The front laser scanner warning zone 2 is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The front scanner sees something inside the second warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the warning zone is not triggered.

311 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE2

Description: The rear laser scanner warning zone 2 is violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The rear scanner sees something inside the second warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the warning zone is not triggered.

312 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_DIRTY

Description: The front laser scanner reports dirty window

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner window is dirty

How to recover: Clean the scanner lens.

313 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_DIRTY

Description: The rear laser scanner reports dirty window

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner window is dirty

How to recover: Clean the scanner lens.

314 WARNING_HIGH_LOGGING_RATE

Description: The text log writing rate is high and may affect performance

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: More log events than recommended are collected into the log.

How to recover: If the warning happens only every now and then there is no need to do anything. If the warning stays on please tune the logging parameters in the params.txt file together with Navitec.

315 WARNING_TOO_LARGE_AUTO_ANG_RATE_CORR

Description: Too large odometry turning rate auto correction

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The vehicle turning rate is corrected more than the parameter odo_auto_corr_max_dherr_deg allows. The vehicle kinematics parameters are not correctly calibrated.

How to recover: Recalibrate the vehicle. Remove the startInfo.bin file from the /home/navitec folder. Reboot Navitrol.

316 WARNING_TOO_LARGE_AUTO_ODO_CORR

Description: Too large odometry distance auto correction

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The odometry distance is corrected more than the parameter odo_auto_corr_max_dserr allows. The odometry is not correctly calibrated.

How to recover: Recalibrate the vehicle. Remove the startInfo.bin file from the /home/navitec folder. Reboot Navitrol.

317 WARNING_TEACH_MODE_ENABLED

Description: The position correction is disabled while teaching

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol is in teach mode.

How to recover: Not really an error, just a warning to tell that teaching is on. The warning disappears when the teaching is deactivated.

318 WARNING_TOO_LARGE_AUTO_ANG_CORR

Description: Too large odometry heading auto correction

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The odometry heading angle is corrected more than the parameter odo_auto_corr_max_herr_deg allows. The vehicle kinematics is not correctly calibrated.

How to recover: Recalibrate the vehicle. Remove the startInfo.bin file from the /home/navitec folder. Reboot Navitrol.

319 WARNING_INITIALIZING_POSITION

Description: The position is being initialized

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol is initializing the position.

How to recover: Not really an error, just a warning to tell that the position initializing is on. The warning disappears when the position initialization gets rady.

320 WARNING_LARGE_CUM_XY_CORRECTION

Description: Large cumulative position correction over last meter

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The position is corrected more than the parameter loc_cum_xy_corr_warn allows during the last driven meter.

How to recover: Navitrol recovers from this error automatically when the position correction does not exceed the limit anymore. It is important to know the reason why Navitrol needed to correct the position so much. Take a log and contact Navitec.

321 WARNING_LARGE_CUM_HEADING_CORRECTION

Description: Large cumulative heading correction over last meter

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The heading is corrected more than the parameter loc_cum_h_corr_warn allows over the last driven meter.

How to recover: Navitrol recovers from this error automatically when the heading correction does not exceed the limit anymore. It is important to know the reason why Navitrol needed to correct the heading so much. Take a log and contact Navitec.

322 WARNING_SAFETY_SCANNER_PROTECTION_ZONE

Description: Safety laser scanner protection zone violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The safety scanner sees something inside the protection zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the protection zone is not triggered.

323 WARNING_SAFETY_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE1

Description: Safety laser scanner warning zone 1 violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The safety scanner sees something inside the first warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the protection zone is not triggered.

324 WARNING_SAFETY_SCANNER_WARNING_ZONE2

Description: Safety laser scanner warning zone 2 violated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The safety scanner sees something inside the second warning zone.

How to recover: Check the scanner view with the monitor. Remove obstacles. Clean the scanner if necessary. Check the scanner zone settings. Recovers automatically when the protection zone is not triggered.

325 WARNING_SAFETY_SCANNER_DIRTY

Description: Safety laser scanner reports dirty window

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner window is dirty

How to recover: Clean the scanner lens.

326 WARNING_CANNOT_RUN_MONITOR

Description: The Navitrol Monitor view cannot be updated due to missing scanner or odometry data

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Either scanner or odometry data is missing

How to recover: Check the communication to the scanners. Check that Navitrol receives odometry data from the vehicle.

327 WARNING_DEADREC_HIGH_DT_STDEV

Description: The vehicle motor controller interface update interval standard deviation is too high

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The standard deviation between odometry messages exceeds the odo_max_interval_stdev_us. Navitrol does not receive odometry data at constant intervals.

How to recover: Navitrol expects to get odometry data at constant intervals. The parameter odo_max_interval_stdev_us value must match with the capability of the vehicle controller.

328 WARNING_ODOMETRY_SLIPPING

Description: The wheels are slipping or the odometry is incorrect, increasing correction gains temporarily

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Odometry slipping detection triggered

How to recover: Navitrol recovers from the error automatically. If the warning shows when the wheels do not slip take a log and contact Navitec.

329 WARNING_GENERIC

Description: Generic warning, check log for more details

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Generic warning that could be triggered from various reasons

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

330 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_WRONG_MODE

Description: The front laser scanner is in wrong operating mode

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner is not correctly configured

How to recover: Check the configuration of the scanner.

331 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_WRONG_MODE

Description: The rear laser scanner is in wrong operating mode

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner is not correctly configured

How to recover: Check the configuration of the scanner.

332 WARNING_FRONT_SCANNER_NO_ZONE_INFO

Description: The front laser scanner does not send protection/warning zone intrusion data.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner is not responding to commands as expected.

How to recover: If error "203 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_FRONT_SCANNER" is active, clear that issue first. If error "203 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_FRONT_SCANNER" is not active, take a log and contact Navitec.

333 WARNING_REAR_SCANNER_NO_ZONE_INFO

Description: The rear laser scanner does not send protection/warning zone intrusion data.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The scanner is not responding to commands as expected.

How to recover: How to recover: If error "204 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_REAR_SCANNER" is active, clear that issue first. If error "204 ERROR_NO_SCAN_FROM_REAR_SCANNER" is not active, take a log and contact Navitec.

334 WARNING_NO_REMOTE_CONTROL

Description: Remote control via the WEB interface is not possible due to a version mismatch

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: The version of the WEB service does not match the Navitrol version

How to recover: Contact Navitec for the correct WEB application.

335 WARNING_POSITION_NOT_INITIALIZED

Description: The position hasn't been initialized but the vehicle can be driven as position initialization is not required

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: If the parameter require_position_initialization is set to 0 to allow automatic initialization at stat-up instead of requiring external position initialization, there is a risk that the automatic initialization fails and the position gets uninitialized. Driving is still possible though, since this is just a warning.

How to recover: Initialize the position manually.

336 WARNING_POS_INIT_TIMEOUT

Description: Position initialization stopped due to timeout

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason:

How to recover:

337 WARNING_CHARGER_FAULT

Description: Fault received from charger

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason:

How to recover:

338 WARNING_BMS

Description: Warning received from BMS

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason:

How to recover:

339 WARNING_NO_SCAN_FROM_FRONT_SCANNER

Description: Front scanner hasn't received scans

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the front scanner. Error is considered only as a warning, because the scanner is not used for localization. Otherwise it will stop AGV.

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

340 WARNING_NO_SCAN_FROM_REAR_SCANNER

Description: Rear scanner hasn't received scans

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the rear scanner. Error is considered only as a warning, because the scanner is not used for localization. Otherwise it will stop AGV.

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

341 WARNING_SCANNER_FRONT_HIGH_DT

Description: The intervals between received laser scans from the front scanner is too high

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner measurement messages are not received for a time exceeding the parameter scan_max_dt_err_ms. Error is considered only as a warning, because the scanner is not used for localization. Otherwise it will stop AGV.

How to recover: Check the cables, front scanner and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

342 WARNING_SCANNER_REAR_HIGH_DT

Description: The interval between received laser scans from the rear scanner is too high

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner measurement messages have not been received for a time exceeding the parameter scan_max_dt_err_ms. Error is considered only as a warning, because the scanner is not used for localization. Otherwise it will stop AGV.

How to recover: Check the cables, rear scanner and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

343 WARNING_DISTANCE_TO_TARGET

Description: AGV has driven too far away from unload point. Distance calculation is impossible

Error level: Warning Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Two possible reasons: if AGV stops on the symbolic point, the fork position is defined incorrectly in the parameter file. If AGV drives over the symbolic point then something wrong with the parameters (pc_stop_distance_offset) or/and with the AGV (it cannot be controlled by the Navitrol in such cases as wheel slipping or brakes fail).

How to recover: In case of the first reason check the Distance To Target feature description document to see how the fork parameters should be defined, pay attention to the sign of those parameters. In case of the second reason, check the mechanical part of the AGV, turn the parameter log_pallet_detection, take logs and sent them to the Navitec support team.

344 WARNING_NO_SCAN_FROM_MEAS_SCANNER

Description: One of the measurements scanners hasn't received scans (other than front/rear)

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol has not received scanner measurements from the measurement scanner. Error is considered only as a warning unless feature using data triggers an error.

How to recover: Check the cables, scanners and computer. In case of Ethernet scanner other possible reasons are IP addresses, ports, Ethernet switches, etc.

345 WARNING_LOADING_ENVIRONMENT

Description: Loading environment and segment file data. Loading must be finished before driving can continue

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Environment and segment data is being uploaded to the Navitrol (from different sources, for instance, from NavithorTools).

How to recover: Resets automatically after upload process is finished.

350 WARNING_DRIVING_NOT_ALLOWED

Description: Driving by Navigation SW not allowed due to AGV control mode (not in automatic mode) or fault. Prevents also Navigation SW manual driving (WebUI, Supervisor, Monitor).

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navigation SW with driving

Error reason: There are multiple possibilities for this warning; motor controller fault, Supervisor fault, AGV in manual mode, internal fault.

How to recover: 1. Check active ERRORs, 2. Verify that AGV is in AUTO mode. If neither of these explains why driving is not allowed, then take a log and contact Navitec.

351 WARNING_LICENSE_EXPIRATION

Description: Time limited License is about to expire soon.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: License is a Trial License or other time limited License, and it is about to expire soon. This warning is set when License expires within number of days as defined by parameter license_warning_period_days. This warning can also be disabled by setting parameter license_warning_period_days to 0.

How to recover: License update is required. Expiry date can be checked by taking a log. In the beginning of log.txt one can see all License details, including expiry date if License is time limited.

352 WARNING_IMU_CALIBRATION_ONGOING

Description: The IMU calibration is ongoing, sensor fusion is not active yet

Error level: Warning

Error reason: The sensor fusion has not yet received enough IMU measurement

How to recover: After enough IMU measurements it will automatically reset, however, if the issue persists, check the sensor fusion and IMU parameters

353 WARNING_SENSOR_FUSION_STARTUP_ONGOING

Description: The sensor fusion startup is ongoing, which means that it is not used for localization

Error level: Warning

Error reason: The sensor fusion has not yet received odometry, or the IMU calibration is unfinished

How to recover: Verify why no odometry is received, if the issue persists, take a log and contact Navitec

354 WARNING_FLEET_CONTROL_MSG_PARSE

Description: A message from Fleet Control cannot be parsed.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol received a message from Fleet Control, but its content does not follow the protocol between them.

How to recover: This warning should not happen. Please take a log and contact Navitec.

355 WARNING_SLAM_ACTIVE

Description: SLAM is active

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All

Error reason: SLAM is activated and is currently building a map in the background

How to recover: From Navitrol Monitor, select Navitrol -> Stop SLAM

356 WARNING_SENSOR_FUSION_NOT_USED_FOR_LOC

Description: Sensor fusion enabled but not used for localization due to position initialization.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All

Error reason: Sensor fusion is enabled by parameter, sf_use_sensor_fusion, but the position initialization is ongoing or has not been performed. The position initialization must be performed if require_position_initialization is 1, otherwise sensor fusion is inactive whenever position initialization is active.

How to recover: Perform position initialization or stop initializing the position, depending on parameter value.

Position Control Critical Errors

401 ERROR_VEH_INTE_HIGH_DT

Description: Vehicle motor controller interface update interval is too high

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol cannot communicate with the vehicle controller correctly.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

402 ERROR_MOTOR_CONTROL_FAULT

Description: Motor controller indicates fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Error comes from the motor controller.

How to recover: Check the error from the motor controller (for instance, using Linux terminal or from Navitrol log)

403 ERROR_MOTOR_CONTROL_COMMS

Description: Motor controller communication fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Possible reason can be found from the log. Could be that for example that Navitrol cannot read encoder values.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

404 ERROR_IO

Description: I/O interface is in error state

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: IO board communication fails

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

405 ERROR_POS_CONT_SEG_FILE_PARSING_ERROR

Description: PosCont segment file parsing failed

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving
