Error reason: Navitrol cannot read segment file. There is something wrong with the segment file inside /home/navitec folder

How to recover: Update the segment file

Position Control Errors

501 ERROR_POS_CONT_HEADING_ERR

Description: PosCont too high heading error

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle heading compared to route heading differentiates more than parameter pc_max_head_err. Vehicle cannot start driving.

How to recover: Drive vehicle closer to the route manually.

502 ERROR_POS_CONT_POS_ERR

Description: PosCont too high position error

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle is too far from the path.

How to recover: Drive vehicle closer to the route manually.

503 ERROR_VEH_INTE_NOT_READY

Description: This error indicates that Navitrol's primary vehicle interface is not operational preventing operation.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle interface is not ready at start.

How to recover: Error is not active anymore when Navitrol can communicate with vehicle. If error stays on take a log and contact Navitec.

504 ERROR_VEH_INTE_CONNECTION

Description: Communication to vehicle motor controller not working

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle interface is not working.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

505 ERROR_POS_CONT_FORK_TIME_ERR

Description: PosCont fork value did not reach reference value within time limit

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fork does not follow the command in time. Fork position should reach the reference within the time set by parameter actuator_timer_s.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

506 ERROR_POS_CONT_SPEED_HIGH

Description: Speed value difference too high above the reference value

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle speed is higher than the reference

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

507 ERROR_POS_CONT_SPEED_LOW

Description: Speed value difference too high below the reference value

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle speed is lower than the reference

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

508 ERROR_POS_CONT_FORK_LIMIT_ERR

Description: PosCont fork value outside of hard limits

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fork measurement is outside limits

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

509 ERROR_POS_CONT_SEG_ERROR

Description: PosCont segment error

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Something is wrong with the drive command. Navitrol is not able to find the correct segment. One of the possible reasons is mismatch between Navitrol and Navithor segment files. Another possible reason could be an attempt to create a drive order to the symbolic point where AGV is standing.

How to recover: Try to increase project version of Tools project and upload it. Check drive order data sent to Navitrol. If this does not help, take a log and contact Navitec.

510 ERROR_ACTUATOR_DATA_MISSING_FROM_SEGMENTS

Description: Segment file does not actuator control values

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Segment file is not right for the machine.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

511 ERROR_MOTOR_TEMP_SENSOR

Description: Motor over temperature

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Motor temperature is too high

How to recover: Check the motor and brakes.

512 ERROR_SAFETY_CIRCUIT_COMMS

Description: Safety circuit connection error

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol cannot communicate with safety logic.

How to recover: Check the communication to safety logic.

513 ERROR_DEAD_RECK_JUMP

Description: Deadreckoning detected a jump in raw odometry

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Dead reckoning value jumps.

How to recover: Something is wrong with the dead reckoning values. Take a log and contact Navitec.

514 ERROR_LOAD_POSITION_ERROR

Description: Actuator activation blocked, because AGV is too far away from the symbolic point

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Requested load status is unknown, or target symbolic point is not reached.

How to recover: Error is reset automatically with timer. Try to drive AGV again to symbolic point. The load process should start if the AGV reaches the target symbolic point.

515 ERROR_ACTUATOR_USE_NOT_ALLOWED

Description: Tried to activate actuator on wrong location, e.g. load on unload symbolic point

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason:

How to recover:

516 ERROR_RACKING_WRONG_PARAMETERS

Description: Racking parameters are limiting drive mission to given height

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Target shelf height is not within range of defined actuator parameters. Another reason is that pallet detection parameters are not defined when target symbolic point has pallet detection feature enabled.

How to recover: Error reason is printed to console and to log.txt. Check which parameter was rejecting the drive and find whether target shelf height or parameter is wrong. Other option is to take a log and contact Navitec.

517 ERROR_ACTUATOR_SAFE_ZONE_VIOLATION

Description: Too high difference between target and measured values in actuator safe zone

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: AGV is inside actuator safe zone and measured actuator value is not within tolerances from the target value

How to recover: Check that actuator safety zone is defined so that AGV is never inside it when it is safe to move actuator while driving. Check that safe area around AGV is not too big actuator_safety_zone_marging_meters. Feature works only when actuator_load_min_val is 0. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

518 ERROR_RACKING_AGV_TOO_CLOSE_RACK

Description: AGV too close to rack to be able to move actuator

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: AGV's distance to given target rack is within minimum allowed distance to move actuator.

How to recover: If AGV is in production, check if fleet control is able to drive the AGV first away from the rack automatically. Otherwise, drive AGV away from the rack manually.

519 ERROR_PALLET_DET_FOUND_AND_SEARCHED_MISMATCH

Description: Target detection - found target does not match the searched ones set in message 3032

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Pallet detection found a target that does not match the ones defined in supervisor message 3032

How to recover: Resolve mismatch manually (remove the unwanted pallet) or add the found target to the searched ones.

520 ERROR_BATTERY_HIGH_TEMPERATURE

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

521 ERROR_CANNOT_CHANGE_RACKING_STATE

Description: AGV does not fulfill required criteria to change the current racking state and move to next one

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Multiple reasons. For example, rack was not empty when going to unload a pallet.

How to recover: Check that rack is empty when AGV is going to unload. Check that pallet can be detected when going to load.

522 ERROR_RACKING_EMPTY_SPACE_NOT_DETECTED

Description: Unload area not free. AGV cannot continue driving

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: See description

How to recover: Check that shelf is correct and find out reason why sensor sees there an object. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

523 ERROR_PALLET_POCKET_NOT_FOUND

Description: Couldn't find suitable pocket.

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Pallet pocket was not found when AGV was going to load a pallet.

How to recover: Check that there is a pallet on the shelf. Check whether pocket size parameters are correct and that pallet detection works. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

524 ERROR_RACKING_BEAM_DETECTION_FAILED

Description: Couldn't find suitable beam for detecting the shelf height

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: See description

How to recover: Check that shelf height defined for the area is correct. Check whether parameters affecting beam detection are set properly. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

525 ERROR_PALLET_DET_FAILURE

Description: Couldn't find pallet or target is too far away from expected location

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: See description

How to recover: Check that there is a pallet at the load location and it is not too far or have too much angle offset from expected position. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

526 ERROR_ACTUATOR_OUT_OF_TOLERANCES_CLOSE_RACK

Description: Too high difference between target and measured value close to rack

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: AGV is closer than minimum allowed distance from rack to be able to move the actuator while driving and measured actuator value is not within tolerances from the target value.

How to recover: Check that actuator can keep its position within tolerances when it is not controller. If error came in loading/unloading, check that actuator is not overshooting the tolerances when controlled to target value. Adjust parameter racking_check_point_before_min_dist_rack_offset_m and/or mot_ctrl_max_wheel_dec_ramped_fast_stop if AGV does not stop early enough in front of minimum allowed distance from rack when still controlling actuator to correct height. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

527 ERROR_RACKING_PALLET_LOADING_UNLOADING_ISSUE

Description: The pallet is either being pushed or dragged during loading or unloading respectively

Error level: Fatal

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Pallet is detected to be pushed when going for load the pallet or pallet is detected to be dragged when leaving the rack.

How to recover: Check whether detection gave a false positive or if pallet was actually pushed or dragged. Take a log to Navitec for further analysis. Handle the situation with manual driving and loading operations and acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

528 ERROR_LOAD_SENSOR_CONFLICT_WITH_NAVITHOR

Description: Load sensor does not match with Navithor load status.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: If load_sensor_conflict_gives_error = 1: The sensor does not match Navithor status at the beginning of the buffer lane,at actuator_disable_load_sensor_distance from symbolic point or when the state is changed from Manual. If load_sensor_conflict_gives_error = 2: The sensor does not match Navithor status in Auto state.

How to recover: Check load sensor. If the sensor does not give correct info, check how the pallet is located on the forks. If the sensor gives correct information, the Navithor load status might be incorrect. Doing Unload on Navithor should sync the correct load status to Navithor.

529 ERROR_VEHICLE_POSITION_NOT_CHANGING_WHILE_DRIVING

Description: Odometry data is indicating a change, but position is not changing

Error level: Fatal

Error reason: Common case is the vehicle spinning on spot when trying to drive.

How to recover: User has to physically check the reason and acknowledge the error through NavitrolMonitor, Fleet Control or Navitrol WebInterface.

530 ERROR_CURVATURE_TOO_HIGH

Description: AGV will not be able to drive given trajectory it has limited steer angle

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving (steer drives and omni drives)

Error reason: The given trajectory has too high maximum curvature for the defined steering limits.

How to recover: If the trajectory was automatically generated, user needs to redefine paths using Navithor Tools. If it was custom route, new custom route must be given with lower curvature. If it occurs while driving, take a log and contact Navitec Support.

531 ERROR_RACKING_PALLET_DETECTION_DATA_NOT_UPDATED

Description: The pallet detection data is not available for detecting pushing/dragging of pallet

Error level: Error

Error reason: Pallet is not detected and the distance to pallet cannot be calculated.

How to recover: Check that pallet can be detected with close range. If not, try to change racking_pallet_drag_push_dist_to_pall_loc to have more distance before pallet detection is used. The error is reset with timer. If pallet cannot be detected at all, test pallet detection feature or contact Navitec for pallet detection support.

532 ERROR_RACKING_DISABLED

Description: Received drive order to Rack point, but racking is disabled

Error level: Error

Error reason: Navitrol has received drive order to Rack Symbolic point when the racking feature is disabled on Navitrol side.

How to recover: If the drive to Rack Symbolic point is intentional, enable the racking feature with this parameter: I,racking_mode to 1. If the drive was meant to be only for normal Symbolic point, remove the Rack feature from the Symbolic point using Navithor Tools.

533 ERROR_MODBUS_COMMS

Description: Modbus connection error

Error level: Error

Error reason: Navitrol has problems with connection to the Modbus device.

How to recover: Try to ping the Modbus device. If it is not possible to ping the Modbus from the IPC, check the settings for the IP addres of IPC and Modbus device and check the Ethernet connection. If it possible to ping Modbus device, put parameter log_modbus to 1, take a log and contact Navitec support.

534 ERROR_STACKLOADING_TARGET_TOO_HIGH

Description: The scanning height is over the maximum limit.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Fork height goes over the stack_loading_max_height_mm.

How to recover: Increase the max height parameter. If the fork is at the maximum mechanical height already, set this parameter to 0: stack_loading_max_height_raises_error. Then the fork is decreased to the last found pocket if it reaches this maximum limit. If these doesn't help, take a log and contact Navitec support.

539 ERROR_CANNOT_CREATE_CUSTOM_ROUTE

Description: AGV is too close to target to create custom route

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Docking with custom route is failed, because there is not enough space for the custom route. Meaning that the target is too close to the AGV.

How to recover: The custom route requires at least this much of space: docking_control_point_1_dist_from_machine + docking_control_point_2_dist_from_target for AGV to drive it successfully. These parameters can be set to smaller value and then try again. If there are still issues, contact Navitec for support. The fatal error can be cleared from Monitor or Navithor Client by pressing the Clear Fatal Errors -button.

540 ERROR_BUFFER_LANE_STOP_POINT_NOT_INSIDE_BUFFER_AREA

Description: Stop point is not calculated inside the buffer area, cannot perform pick/drop there.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Calculated stopping point for buffer lane has to be inside the buffer area, otherwise pick/drop cannot be performed.

How to recover: If AGV is going for a pick, move the pallet inside the buffer area and check that the stop distance parameter is correct. docking_stop_distance if docking_to_target_enabled is used and buffer_stop_dist_from_object_when_loading for normal load buffer without docking. If AGV is going for a drop, check that there is still space in the buffer lane and check the stop distance parameter buffer_stop_dist_from_object_when_unloading. If there are still issues, contact Navitec for support. The fatal error can be cleared from Monitor or Navithor Client by pressing the Clear Fatal Errors -button.

541 ERROR_DRIVE_ORDER_TOO_CLOSE_TO_RACK

Description: Drive order given too close to rack, cannot drive closer

Error level: Error

Error reason: AGV has a drive order to or close to a rack symbolic point which it cannot reach safely.

How to recover: Give drive order to rack with the shelf ID if it is needed to drive there. Check that the safety limit parameters are not affecting the drive on the aisles (e.g., racking_min_dist_rack_to_move_actuator_meters)

542 ERROR_RACKING_SHELF_ID_NOT_VALID

Description: Received non-positive shelf ID, cannot continue driving.

Error level: Error

Error reason: AGV receives a racking drive order that contains unknown shelf ID.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

543 ERROR_COUPLED_DRIVE_ACTIVE_ERRORS

Description: Errors are active on one or more machines in coupled drive

Error level: Error

Error reason: See description.

How to recover: Check what error(s) is active on a follower AGV(s) and act according to the error.

544 ERROR_EXT_LOC_NOT_SAFE_TO_DRIVE

Description: Driving safety using external localization is not guaranteed.

Error level: Error

Error reason: AGV is given a drive order close to QR stop point after restart of software or after AGV has already driven to the same symbolic point.

How to recover: Drive AGV away from the symbolic point (further than ext_loc_check_path_ready_dist). Then, AGV can be driven back to the symbolic point.

545 ERROR_EXT_LOC_STOP_POINT_NOT_REACHED

Description: AGV has not reached the external localization stop point.

Error level: Error

Error reason: AGV has been given a drive order to symbolic point that has QR stop point defined but it stops to symbolic point using normal scanner navigation.

How to recover: Check that QR stop point is needed in the symbolic point and if so check that ext_loc_stop_point_enabled has been set to 1 and that QR stop point is correct. Drive AGV away from the symbolic point (further than ext_loc_check_path_ready_dist). Then, AGV can be driven back to the symbolic point.

546 ERROR_POCKET_DET_TARGET_TOO_HIGH

Description: Pocket detection target goes higher than actuator_max_val

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Pocket detection target height goes over max actuator val. Pocket detection maximum height is calculated from target shelf height + stack_loading_max_pocket_size_mm parameter. If that height goes over actuator_max_val parameter, this error is shown.

How to recover: Decrease the stack_loading_max_pocket_size_mm or increase the actuator_max_val parameter.

547 ERROR_BARRIER_STOP_FAILED

Description: Barrier stop has failed.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Either the agv reached the end destination without reaching all signals, or a timeout happened after reaching the first signal but not the others. Another possible reason is that another error was triggered during the barrier stop process.

How to recover: Check the barrier stop sensors on the agv. Ensure the barrier_stop_check_dist and barrier_stop_signal_max_wait_time_ms are set correctly.

548 ERROR_AGV_AT_RACK_AFTER_STARTUP

Description: AGV is too close to rack after start. Cannot do anything.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: AGV is on the rack symbolic point or inside the racking_min_dist_rack_to_move_actuator_meters from the rack symbolic point when the system is started.

How to recover: Drive the AGV manually away from the rack (further away than the racking_min_dist_rack_to_move_actuator_meters) and clear the fatal error from the Monitor or from the Client.

549 ERROR_STACKLOADING_POCKET_FOUND_TOO_LOW

Description: The found pocket was found too low.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: The pocket (space between pallet legs) is lower than stack_loading_max_decrease_val_after_scan_mm from the current fork height.

How to recover: Increase this parameter. The idea is that this parameter is a bit higher than the highest pallet on the stack. It is used to avoid the fork to pick multiple pallets as one. If the AGV is allowed to pick multiple pallets this parameter can be set to 0 to disable this check. If changing this parameter doesn't help, take a log and contact Navitec support.

550 ERROR_LOAD_UNLOAD_HEIGHT_TOO_LOW

Description: The loading or unloading target height is too low. Cannot perform load or unload.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Loading target height is lower that current actuator height or unloading target height is lower than minimum actuator height.

How to recover: Fatal error can be cleared from Monitor or Client. Check these parameters: from Navitrol params.txt: actuator_load_aboard_offset_mm, actuator_load_min_val and actuator_min_val. From machine type parameter file: ACTUATOR_MIN_VAL and ACTUATOR_LOAD_MIN_VAL. And the route heights. The load target height should be in general case, the route height + offset or minimum load height. The unload target height is in general case, the route height**.** This error takes automatic log. Take that from the IPC logs folder (folder name is same as the error) and contact Navitec support.

551 ERROR_RTR_AND_VECTOR_DRIVE_CONFLICT

Description: Return to route is not possible when vector drive is used, turn off vector drive to use return to route.

Error level: error

Error reason: Vector driving and return to route both use custom route functionality and therefore cannot be used simultaneously. For using return to route, vector driving must be deactivated..

How to recover: Deactivate vector driving over the CAN interface to enable return to route.

553 ERROR_SPEED_CONTROL_STOPPED_AGV_DID_NOT_MOVE

Description: AGV did not move within the time limit. Stopping speed control

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: One of the driving motors is standing still even though target speed is non-zero,

How to recover: Check if the motor is physically rotating. Check odometry data (speed/encoder values) from the motor controllers. Make sure that parameter "speed_timer_s" values are higher than motor response time.

554 ERROR_DESTINATION_UPDATE_FAILED

Description: Failed to find acceptable route to updated destination

Error level: error

Error reason: Updated destination from Supervisor can not be reached from current AGV position and driving direction.

How to recover: The error will stop the AGV and will reset by itself. Last drive order is terminated when this error is triggered. Supervisor can send a new drive order to desired destination after error has reset.

555 ERROR_LOAD_SENSOR_STATUS_CHANGED_IN_AUTO

Description: Load sensor status changed in auto state. Check that sensor is reporting correct status or that load is placed firmly on the AGV

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Load sensor status changed in Auto state and it has been on the new value for load_sensor_status_change_timer_ms amount of time.

How to recover: Check that load sensor reports the correct value and check that load is placed firmly to the AGV.

556 ERROR_LOAD_SENSOR_CONFLICT_AFTER_PICKUP

Description: Load sensor does not detect pallet after pick up.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Load sensor is 0 after pick up is done.

How to recover: Check that load sensor reports the correct value and check that load is placed firmly to the AGV. If the sensor cannot be used after the pick up for some reason, this error can be disabled with this parameter: actuator_check_load_sensor_status_after_loading.

557 ERROR_LOAD_SENSOR_CONFLICT_AFTER_DROPOFF

Description: Load sensor detects pallet after drop off.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Load sensor is 1 after drop off is done.

How to recover: Check that load sensor reports the correct value. If the sensor cannot be used after the drop off, this error can be disabled with this parameter: actuator_check_load_sensor_status_after_unloading.

558 ERROR_TOO_MANY_SIMILAR_ACTUATORS

Description: Too many similar actuators requested for control.

Error level: error

Error reason: The supervisor requests control of too many similar actuators at the same time.

How to recover: Reduce the amount of requested simultaneously controlled similar actuators and control them alternately.

559 ERROR_ACTUATOR_SAFETY_VIOLATED

Description: Safety sensor reported that actuator or AGV is colliding. Stopping all actuator controls.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: Some protruding goods or other obstacle is causing a collision risk for the AGV body or the actuator.

How to recover: Inspect the surroundings of the AGV, actuator and load before moving out the AGV.

560 ERROR_TARGET_DETECTION_REF_TOO_HIGH

Description: Target detection reference goes higher than actuator_max_val.

Error level: Fatal error

Error reason: The combination of shelf height and target detection height addition exceeds the actuator maximum height.

How to recover: If the actuator_max_val cannot be increased, the detection addition must be decreased or the shelf cannot be used for this kind of load detection.

561 ERROR_CLEANING_ACTUATOR_TIMEOUT

Description: Cleaning actuator did not reach reference value within the time limit.

Error level: Error

Error reason: Some of the cleaning actuator did not follow the command for some time.

How to recover: Check the command and measurement from the interface. Check the actuator wiring, position and limit switches position (if applicable).

562 ERROR_3D_PARTIAL_VIEWS_INVALID

Description: 3D detection is enabled but the partial views for 3d detection are invalid or could not be found.

Error level: Error

Error reason: The required files for detection could not be found on the AGV, based on parameter obj_reg_3d_model_name[i]

How to recover: Upload the CAD file via Monitor form, verify that the parameter name is correct

563 ERROR_3D_PREREQUISITES_NOT_FOUND

Description: 3D detection is enabled but the required 3rd party libraries could not be found on the AGV.

Error level: Error

Error reason: The third party library have not been properly installed on the AGV.

How to recover: Follow the installation instructions provided in the documentation

564 ERROR_ABS_POS_TOO_LARGE_ESTIMATE_DEVIATION

Description: The absolute positioning pose estimate deviates too much from current pose.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any

Error reason: The obtained absolute positioning pose estimate deviates by more than sf_abspos_max_position_deviation or sf_abspos_max_angle_deviation_deg from the current pose

How to recover: Increase the parameter values or verify why the absolute positioning pose estimate deviates from the current. If the issue persists, take a log and contact Navitec.

565 ERROR_ABS_POS_NO_CONF_RECEIVED

Description: No valid absolute position measurement confidence received in a time interval of parameter sf_abspos_max_time_since_valid_conf_ms_arr[]

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with ROS.

Error reason: Navitrol has not received any valid absolute positioning measurement confidence in a time interval of parameter sf_abspos_max_time_since_valid_conf_ms_arr[].

How to recover:

  • Check that Navitec ROS Docker container is running (docker ps -a)
  • Check that GIM ROS Docker containers are running (docker ps -a)
  • Check the 'Absolute positioning' document for
    • Advanced troubleshooting
    • Required parameters for ROS and sensor fusion

566 ERROR_NO_PERMISSION_TO_DRIVE_CUSTOM_ROUTE

Description: Cannot drive custom route, because fleet control did not give permission.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fleet control didn't allow driving custom route. Check that the area is not reserved by any other AGV. If Navithor is the fleet control, check Navithor logs for more details why the custom route was rejected.

How to recover: Error is reset automatically with a timer. Move the blocking AGVs away and try again.

567 ERROR_CUSTOM_ROUTE_FLEET_CONTROL_PERMISSION_TIMEOUT

Description: Cannot drive custom route, didn't receive fleet control permission in time.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fleet control didn't answer to Navitrol if it is okay to drive custom route within fleet_control_wait_time_for_answer_s time. Increase the parameter or check Navithor (if that is the fleet control) logs for more details why there was no answer within time.

How to recover: Error is reset automatically with a timer. Try again and if the issue persist, take fleet control log and contact Navitec.

568 ERROR_PICKUP_OR_DROPOFF_FAILURE

Description: Cannot perform pickup or drop-off, trajectory does not exist or base height not valid.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: No trajectory, invalid current trajectory point or couldn't get any base height when trying to do pickup or drop-off

How to recover: Error is reset automatically with a timer. Drive AGV away and then back and try again pickup or drop-off and if the issue persist, take log and contact Navitec.

569 ERROR_DOCKING_FAILED

Description: Docking failed in a way that requires manual intervention.

Error level: Fatal error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fatal failure during docking process.

How to recover: See the automatically taken log for more details and resolve the docking situation and the error reason manually. Release the fatal error and retry docking from the beginning.

571 ERROR_DRIVING_TOWARDS_STACK_NOT_ALLOWED

Description: Driving towards stack in wrong state, drive away to reset the stacking state. Used in both Picking from stack and Drop-off to stack features.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

How to recover: Drive AGV away from the stack to reset the state.

Position Control Warnings

601 WARNING_AGV_LOW_BATTERY

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

602 WARNING_POS_CONT_FORK_WAR

Description: PosCont fork value not within limits. Move not allowed

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fork height is too far from the reference value

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

603 WARNING_ESTOP_ACTIVE

Description: Emergency stop is active

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: ESTOP is active

How to recover: Release ESTOP

604 WARNING_FW_OBSTACLE

Description: Obstacle detected in front of vehicle. Speed may be limited

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Scanner detects obstacle in front of the vehicle

How to recover: Recovers automatically when the obstacle is not seen anymore. Remove the obstacle, change the route or modify warning zones.

605 WARNING_BW_OBSTACLE

Description: Obstacle detected behind of vehicle. Speed may be limited

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Scanner detects obstacle behind the vehicle

How to recover: Recovers automatically when the obstacle is not seen anymore. Remove the obstacle, change the route or modify warning zones.

606 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_EXTERNAL_SOURCE

Description: Slow down request received from external source (e.g. PLC or IO)

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: See the reason from PLC or IO

How to recover: Recovers automatically when PLC does not ask Navitrol to slow down anymore

607 WARNING_SAFETY_SCANNER_OBSTACLE

Description: Obstacle detected by one of safety scanners. Speed may be limited

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: One of the safety scanners detects obstacle

How to recover: Recovers automatically when the obstacle is not seen anymore. Remove the obstacle, change the route or modify warning zones.

608 WARNING_VEH_INTE_HIGH_DT_STDEV

Description: Vehicle motor controller interface update interval standard deviance is too high

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Vehicle control interval is longer than parameter control_interval_max_stdev_us

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

609 WARNING_STANDALONE_DISABLED

Description: Standalone feature disabled. Possible reasons Navithor is connected or Production simulation is enabled in Monitor

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: When Navitrol is connected to Navithor or Production simulation is enabled at Navitrol monitor they have control and Navitrol cannot be commanded as standalone

How to recover: Close other connections.

610 WARNING_NO_SEG_FILE

Description: Segment file not found

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: There is no segment file in /home/navitec folder

How to recover: Upload segment file to Navitrol

611 WARNING_AGV_NO_BATTERY_LEVEL

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

612 WARNING_TARGET_NOT_DETECTED

Description: Target for docking not detected

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol cannot find the target for docking

How to recover: Make sure that target is present. If this is already a case, take a log and contact Navitec.

613 WARNING_TARGET_APPROACH_ERROR

Description: Target location differs too much from expected during docking.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol cannot find the target anymore or is not capable to drive to target

How to recover: Make sure that target is present at correct place. If this is already a case, take a log and contact Navitec.

614 WARNING_DRIVING_WITH_ONLY_ODOMETRY

Description: Location correction disabled, driving with only odometry

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol is driving with odometry only because it is told to do so because of the segment properties

How to recover: Information only. Not an error

615 WARNING_LOW_POS_CONF_SLOWED_DOWN

Description: Slowing down due to low position confidence

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Position confidence has dropped below the limits. Slowing down.

How to recover: Should recover automatically. If not initialize position. If the warning keeps coming take a log and contact Navitec.

616 WARNING_NAVITHOR_NOT_CONNECTED

Description: Couldn't connect to Navithor

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has no communication to Navitrol.

How to recover: Make sure that communication parameters are correct. Check that Navitrol server is running.

617 WARNING_SPEED_LIMITED

Description: Speed limited e.g. because of load status

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has limited speed because vehicle is loaded

How to recover: Information only

618 WARNING_LOAD_POSITION_ERROR

Description: Actuator activation was blocked, because AGV is too far away from the symbolic point

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason:

How to recover:

619 WARNING_ACTUATOR_USE_NOT_ALLOWED

Description: Tried to activate actuator on wrong location, e.g. load on unload symbolic point

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason:

How to recover:

620 WARNING_SYMBOL_POINT_OCCUPIED

Description: Object detected in occupancy check area

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason:

How to recover:

621 WARNING_DRIVE_ORDER_DISABLED

Description: Drive order was disabled by an external source

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason:

How to recover:

622 WARNING_OBSTACLE_DETECTED

Description: Detected an obstacle

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: There are scan points on current route and the AGV will collide into them if it continues driving

How to recover: Obstacle disappears

Related features:

  • Obstacle avoidance V2
  • Obstacle Avoidance

623 WARNING_OBSTACLE_AVOIDANCE_V2_HIGH_DT

Description: Obstacle avoidance V2 is not performing frequently enough

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Obstacle avoidance V2 lacks of sufficient computational resources

How to recover: Reduce the value of the following parameters to save computational resources:

  • ros_obst_av_max_plan_dist
  • ros_obst_det_max_scan_dist
  • ros_obst_av_publish_map (to 0)

Related features:

  • Obstacle avoidance V2

624 WARNING_WAITING_OBSTACLE_BYPASS_PERMISSION

Description: Waiting for fleet control permission to drive around the obstacle

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: The AGV needs permission from fleet control to leave nominal route and drive around the obstacle

How to recover: Get permission from fleet control

Related features:

  • Obstacle avoidance V2
  • Obstacle Avoidance

625 WARNING_NO_OBSTACLE_ZONES

Description: Cannot use obstacle avoidance because no obstacle zones have been defined

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: There are no obstacle zones in the environment (segment file)

How to recover: Load a new environment (segment file) with obstacle avoidance zones. Use parameter obst_av_zones,0 to not require or use zones at all.

626 WARNING_MOVING_OBSTACLE

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle because the obstacle is moving.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: There is a moving obstacle around the current route

How to recover: Obstacle stops moving or disappears

627 WARNING_BYPASS_ROUTE_OUT_OF_ZONE

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle because the route would be outsize obstacle avoidance zone

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Cannot drive around the obstacle because the route would be outsize obstacle avoidance zone

How to recover: The algorithm will try the other side if possible. Else, change the obstacle avoidance zones or wait that the obstacle disappears

628 WARNING_OBSTACLE_TOO_CLOSE

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle because it is too close to the AGV

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Obstacle is too close to the AGV

How to recover: Obstacle disappears

Related features:

  • Obstacle avoidance V2
  • Obstacle Avoidance

629 WARNING_CANNOT_BYPASS_REVERSING_TO_NOMINAL_ROUTE

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle. Reversing back to nominal route

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Tried to plan a route around the obstacle for the maximum allowed time without success

How to recover: The AGV will drive back to the nominal route automatically and the warning will disappear

630 WARNING_CANNOT_BYPASS_DID_NOT_GET_FLEET_CONTROL_PERMISSION

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle because fleet control permission was not granted

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Fleet control did not give permission to drive around the obstacle

How to recover: Wait, try again later or obstacle disappears

Related features:

  • Obstacle avoidance V2
  • Obstacle Avoidance

631 WARNING_BEGINNING_DRIVING_AROUND_OBSTACLE

Description: Beginning to drive around the obstacle

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: The AGV will leave the nominal route and begin driving around the obstacle

How to recover: This warning is just to inform the user -- it is not an error. The warning will disappear itself

632 WARNING_COULD_NOT_CREATE_EXTEND_DRIVE_WHILE_BYPASSING

Description: Extend drive while bypassing failed

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Could not extend the current route while driving around the obstacle

How to recover: Change fleet control extend drive parameters or try again

633 WARNING_WRONG_AGV_STATUS_MESSAGE_VERSION

Description: Cannot use obstacle avoidance with fleet control because AGV status message version is wrong

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: The value of the parameter agv_status_message_version is not 2 when using fleet control

How to recover: Either do not use fleet control or change agv_status_message_version to 2

634 WARNING_CANNOT_BYPASS_OBSTACLE_TOO_WIDE

Description: Cannot drive around the obstacle because it is too wide

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: The AGV would have to make too sharp a turn and get far away from the nominal route

How to recover: Obstacle disappears

635 WARNING_BATTERY_FULL_CHARGE_NEEDED

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

636 WARNING_BATTERY_ERROR_OR_WARNING_ACTIVE

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

637 WARNING_LOAD_DETECTION_CONFLICT

Description: Load detection sensor conflicts with fleet control's status of loading state

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Measurement from load detection sensor is not what fleet control expects

How to recover: Check sensor reading is valid. Take a log and contact Navitec.

638 WARNING_SENSOR_FAILURE_IN_LOADING

Description: Load detection sensor doesn't recognize a load

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Load detection sensor doesn't find a load onboard after the loading sequence has been completed or during the load sequence.

How to recover: Check sensor reading is valid. If there is a pallet on the forks, check why the sensor is not triggered. If there is no pallet, abort drive and do Unload on Navithor to update the Navithor load status.

639 WARNING_CHARGING_ACTIVE

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

642 WARNING_EXTERNAL_SPEED_LIMITATION

Description: Speed is limited below reference by external source

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has received information that speed is limited by vehicle controller and vehicle is currently not following reference speed value.

How to recover: Vehicle speed is close enough to reference value

643 WARNING_OBSTACLE_TOO_LONG

Description: Length of bypassed obstacle is limited

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol cannot bypass obstacle because it is too long.

How to recover: Check the dimensions of the obstacle and check value in the parameter obst_max_obstacle_bypassed.

644 WARNING_CHANGING_LOAD_OR_UNLOAD_HEIGHT

Description: The correct height is detected with sensor.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Block stacking or stack loading started. AGV is stopped and is scanning the stack of pallets with a sensor for defining the correct unload or load height. Should be cleared when the height is set and the AGV continues driving.

How to recover: This warning is just to inform the user -- it is not an error. The warning will disappear itself in normal case. If it is enabled far away from the load or unload symbolic point or the AGV is not on the buffer area, reboot the AGV or take a log and contact Navitec.

645 WARNING_LOAD_ABOARD_WHEN_DRIVING_TO_LOAD_BUFFER

Description: Navitrol load status is load aboard. Can't drive to load buffer with load.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol believes that it has a pallet loaded when driving to load buffer.

How to recover: The Navitrol load status needs to be changed by checking the load sensor (if it is used and the sensor is read during drive) or doing unload from fleet control.

646 WARNING_BATTERY_HIGH_TEMPERATURE

See feature documentation for Charge and Battery management.

647 WARNING_DECREASING_FORK_TO_ROUTE_LEVEL

Description: Vehicle is stopped until fork reaches the route height

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Used in situation where after Stackloading the AGV has picked a pallet from the stack, driven out from the stack and start to decreasing the fork back to the route level. This is used only to give customer information what is going on. The AGV is stopped with softstop and it doesn't show any information on the Monitor.

How to recover: Should be reset automatically when the fork height reaches the target value.

648 WARNING_RACKING_PRECHECKS

Description: AGV stopped due to racking prechecks

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Information that AGV is executing prechecks before driving to the rack. Prechecks can be for example empty space detection or pallet detection.

How to recover: Normally it is used just for information. If the warning persists for long time and AGV is not able to continue task execution, take a log and contact Navitec.

649 WARNING_BARRIER_STOP_FAILED

Description: Performing Barrier stop feature failed

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: The AGV did drive to a symbolic point location that has Barrier stop tag enabled without getting both stop signals.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds.

650 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_SOURCE_MONITOR

Description: Slow down request received from monitoring software.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Slow down is received from NavitrolMonitor. Probably, abort or pause button has been pressed.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds.

651 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_SOURCE_SUPERVISOR

Description: Slow down request received from supervisor interface.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Slow down/abort command is received from Supervisor.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds.

652 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_SOURCE_FLEET_CONTROL

Description: Slow down request received from fleet control.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Slow down/abort command is received from fleet control (Navithor or external fleet control).

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds.

653 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_SOURCE_CONSOLE

Description: Slow down request received from console.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Slow down/abort command is received from console.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds.

654 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_SOURCE_ACTIVE_ERROR

Description: Slow down request because of active error.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has slowed down because of error active while driving.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds. Check error that activated while driving in this document.

655 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_COUPLED_DRIVE_COMM

Description: Slow down because of coupled drive communication issues.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has slowed down because of issues in coupled drove communications.

How to recover: Automatically reset after few seconds. Check coupled drive communications.

656 WARNING_SLOWED_DOWN_AUTO_MOVE_DELAY

Description: Slow down because of auto move delay.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol has slowed down because of active auto move delay.

How to recover: Automatically reset after auto move delay has been reset. Check auto move delay parameters.

657 WARNING_RETURN_TO_ROUTE_FAILED

Description: Return to route feature could not find a suitable return point or command was rejected as the AGV was not in standby state.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Either the AGV was not on standby mode when the signal was given, or a suitable return route (determined by the parameters) was not found.

How to recover: Will be reset automatically after a few seconds. If the AGV was not on standby, abort the previous task and try again. If a suitable path was not found, either move the AGV manually closer to a defined path or try adjusting the parameters to allow larger errors.

658 WARNING_DETECTING_TARGET

Description: AGV is doing target detection and is stopped because of the active detection.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: AGV is closer to a detected object than parameter value (obj_reg_3d_stop_before_object_is_detected_and_found_dist). AGV will try to do the detection while being stopped

How to recover: Will be reset automatically if the AGV can detect the target while being stopped or if the target has been missed obj_reg_3d_target_max_n_times_missing times

659 WARNING_OBSTACLE_AVOIDANCE_V2_SUSPENDED

Description: Obstacle avoidance V2 is suspended momentarily

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All

Error reason: Obstacle avoidance V2 is suspended due to other feature being active

How to recover: See warning 355 WARNING_SLAM_ACTIVE

660 WARNING_WAITING_CUSTOM_ROUTE_FLEET_CONTROL_PERMISSION

Description: Waiting for fleet control permission before driving custom route.

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Navitrol is waiting for fleet control to give permission to drive custom route.

How to recover: Warning is reset after permission is given or if ERROR_NO_PERMISSION_TO_DRIVE_CUSTOM_ROUTE or ERROR_CUSTOM_ROUTE_FLEET_CONTROL_PERMISSION_TIMEOUT is set.

661 WARNING_ROUTE_FREE_NAVIGATION_FAILED

Description: Route-free navigation command was given, but couldn't complete

Error level: warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: There is something preventing the completion of a route-free navigation command to the given ocation. Maybe it can not be reached or the planner is not enabled or connected.

How to recover: Try planning to a different position first. Ensure that the correct parameters are set.

662 WARNING_BYPASS_ROUTE_PLANNING_ACTIVE

Description: Obstacle avoidance V2 tries to find actively a bypass path around the obstacle(s)

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Navitrol with driving

Error reason: Obstacle avoidance V2 has detected at least one obstacle along the route, and the distance between the AGV and the (first) obstacle is less than the defined threshold value for starting the bypass route planning (see parameter ros_obst_av_bypass_planning_dist)

How to recover: Warning disappears once the obstacle disappears / moves off from the route / a valid bypass route has been found

665 WARNING_3D_SENSOR_DATA_NOT_RECEIVED

Description: The 3d sensor data is not received. If DDS is used the message initialization might also be the root cause.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Any

Error reason: The 3d sensor data is not received. If DDS is used the message initialization might also be the root cause.

How to recover: Verify that the sensor IP is correct, parameter obj_reg_3d_sensor_ip. If DDS is used, check that the dds_pointcloud2_topic_name is correct and that the sensor's driver is running and relaying sensor data. Verify network configurations are correct.

Hardware/Machine Specific Critical Errors

701 ERROR_SCANNER_PARAMS_NOT_VALID

Description: Scanner parameters are not valid

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Scanner parameters inside params.txt file are wrong

How to recover: Correct the parameter file

702 ERROR_FRONT_SCANNER_FAULT

Description: Front scanner reports internal hardware fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Check the scanner

How to recover: Fix the scanner

703 ERROR_REAR_SCANNER_FAULT

Description: Rear scanner reports internal hardware fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Check the scanner

How to recover: Fix the scanner

704 ERROR_LIFT_CTRL_NOCOMMS

Description: Lift motor controller communication failure

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with lift0,

Error reason: Communication to lift controller fails

How to recover: Check the cables and lift controller. Take a log and contact Navitec.

705 ERROR_LIFT_CTRL_CONTROLLER_FAULT

Description: Lift motor controller indicates fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Lift controller indicates fault

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

706 ERROR_LIFT_CTRL_CALIB_FAILED_OUT_OF_LIMITS

Description: Lift height measurement calibration failed to move lift so limit switches would be released

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Lift needs to drive to limit in order to calibrate it. Now this driving to limit failed.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

707 ERROR_PLC_FAILURE

Description: PLC error

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: PLC is in error state. No driving is allowed

How to recover: Check the PLC

708 ERROR_NO_PLC_DATA

Description: no communication to PLC

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol cannot communicate with PLC

How to recover: Check the PLC and cables. Take a log and contact Navitec.

709 ERROR_CAN_FAILURE

Description: CAN bus, hardware or driver error.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Machines with CAN bus

Error reason: Something is wrong with the CAN bus. CAN initialization fails or Rx/Tx counters are accumulating

How to recover:

  • Check IPC CAN interface and related parameters; can_ch, can_bitrate_k.
  • Check the CAN bus status with CAN Analyser.
  • Check for bus issues: CAN bus topology and termination, CAN wiring (HI/LO), grounding
  • Check for nodes with different speeds

710 ERROR_TOO_LARGE_STEER_ANGLE

Description: Measured Steering angle too large

Error level: Error

Machine types: Steer drive machines with Schwarzmueller controller

Error Reason: Steering encoder reports larger value than parameter mot_ctrl_steer_angle_hard_limit_deg

How to recover: Check that steering is within reasonable limits. Check the parameter value.

711 ERROR_SAFETY_SCANNER_FAULT

Description: Safety scanner reports internal hardware fault

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Check the scanner

How to recover: Fix the scanner

712 ERROR_SAFE_OUTPUTS_ACTIVE

Description: Safe outputs are active: Speed outputs are being zeroed and actuator controls disabled

Error level: Error

Machine types: Ethernet and CAN controlled machines

Error reason: Navitrol internal fault

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec

713 ERROR_TRAILER_TRANSPORT_COUPLING

Description: Failure in trailer coupling or uncoupling sequence

Error level: Fatal error

Machine types: Omni drive (only when trailer transport feature is enabled)

Error reason:

  • Trailer was lost or connected unexpectedly
    • While coupled or uncoupled the trailer coupling status from supervisor is changed unexpectedly.
    • For example, while Navitrol thinks that the trailer is coupled to the AGV and driving and coupling status changes to uncoupled.
    • No error is raised on unexpected changes during coupling and uncoupling sequences
  • Kingpin was not found
    • During coupling when reversing to kingpin the maximum drive distance is reached without coupling status indicating that the kingpin is detected.
    • Max drive distance is determined by trailer_kingpin_straight_drive_dist
  • The AGV system does not respond to coupling action requests
    • During coupling and coupling sequence the state has been same for too long.
    • Max wait time is determined by trailer_error_timer_ms
  • During uncoupling if the automatic return to route fails
    • Either return to route parameters have not been calibrated correctly or the AGV is too far from the route to return.

How to recover: User should 1. check the situation. 2. correct the cause of the issue 3. send correct coupling status to Navitrol 4. reset the fatal error. After resetting the error Navitrol will initialize trailer transport state based on the given coupling status.

714 ERROR_TRAILER_STATUS_NOT_RECEIVED

Description: Valid trailer transport status not received

Error level: Error

Machine types: Omni drive (only when trailer transport feature is enabled)

Error reason: This error is set if valid trailer status has been received once but after that either the communication is lost, or data received is invalid for more than one second.

How to recover: To fix the issue make sure that the supervisor sends Message 3002 -- Supervisor status, Trailer transport status section (section ID = 12) with valid data.

715 ERROR_TRAILER_ANGLE_NOT_DETECTED

Description: Failed to detect the trailer angle

Error level: Error

Machine types: Omni drive (only when trailer transport feature is enabled)

Error reason: This error is set if trailer angle is not detected successfully when coupled to a trailer. Possible reasons are that the pallet detection is not enabled and set up correctly or the angle detection scanner does find the wheels in the near the axles defined with "Set trailer dimensions"-supervisor message.

How to recover: Make sure that the scanner and pallet detection parameters has been configured correctly and that the scanner sees the wheels of the trailer. The error is automatically reset when the trailer angle is successfully detected -- Successfully detected angle is rendered as a green line in Navitrol Monitor.

716 ERROR_TRAILER_ANGLE_TOO_LARGE

Description: Detected trailer angle exceeds the set limits

Error level: Error

Machine types: Omni drive (only when trailer transport feature is enabled)

Error reason: This error is set if detected trailer angle error compared to the AGV angle is larger than the limits set with parameters trailer_max_heading_err_close_deg and trailer_max_heading_err_far_deg. See the parameters chapter for more information.

How to recover: The error is automatically reset when the trailer angle is back within the limits. However, getting the angle error to the limits while error is active will most likely require manual control since automatic driving is prevented by the error.

Hardware/Machine Specific Errors

801 ERROR_PLC_COMMS_STOP

Description: PLC stopped machine due to communication break

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with PLC controlling the driving

Error reason: PLC has noticed communication error and stops the driving

How to recover: Check the communication with PLC

802 ERROR_GENERIC_IO_DEFINITIONS

Description: error or problem in generic I/O definitions

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with PLC controlling the driving

Error reason: IO definitions are wrong

How to recover: Check the IO definitions at the parameter file and PLC

803 ERROR_ETH_ERROR

Description: Error on AGV

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet interface

Error reason: Message received over Ethernet interface shows that there is an active error and driving is not allowed

How to recover: Recovers automatically when the error disappears. Check the error reason from the source.

804 ERROR_ETH_UNKNOWN_STATUS

Description: AGV sent unknown error status

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet interface

Error reason: PLC sent unknown status for driving enabled

How to recover: Check why PLC sent this value. Correct the source.

805 ERROR_CAN_ALL_NODES_NOT_OPER

Description: One or more nodes not operational or all receive messages not detected

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: Some nodes are missing from the CAN bus

How to recover: Check the CAN bus with CAN tools. Check that all the nodes that should be visible are sending data.

806 ERROR_CAN_RX_TIMEOUT

Description: Receive timeout in one or more receive messages. All required messages have however been seen at least once in this case. One typical reason for these errors is configuration error of a CANOpen slave device; more specifically the transmission mode (see section CANOpen basics for more details)

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: Some message(s) are not received in time.

How to recover: Set parameter log_can_summary to 1 and check the "RX_SUM" logging. Check the CAN bus with CAN Analyser and validate that all the messages are on the bus. Take a log and contact Navitec.

807 ERROR_CAN_DATA

Description: Invalid data in CAN msg

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: CAN data that Navitrol received is not correct

How to recover: Set parameter log_can to 1, take a log and contact Navitec.

808 ERROR_CAN_CONFIG

Description: CAN slave configuration failure

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: Two possible reason:

  • Navitrol was not able to configure the CAN slaves. Navitrol is not a NMT master even if slave configurations (SDO messages) are expected. Check parameter can_nmt_master.
  • SDO write to a slave node fails.

How to recover: Set parameter log_can to 1. Take a log and contact Navitec

809 ERROR_AGV_CONTROLLER

Description: AGV controller alarm

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN or EhterCAT interface

Error reason: AGV controller reports error to Navitrol

How to recover: Check the error on AGV controller. Recovers automatically when the error is gone.

810 ERROR_RLS_SENSOR

Description: RLS sensor failure

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with RLS sensor

Error reason: RLS sensor reports error

How to recover: Fix the sensor

811 ERROR_HITCH_TONGUE_PRESENT_TIMEOUT

Description: Hitch tongue wasn't detected within time limit

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Tongue is not detected within time limit set by hitch_tongue_present_timeout_ms

How to recover: Check the sensor and confirm that tongue is present.

812 ERROR_HITCH_OPEN_TIMEOUT

Description: Hitch didn't open within time limit

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Hitch is closed for longer than hitch_pin_open_close_max_time_ms

How to recover: Check why the hitch does not open. Check the hitch closed sensor.

813 ERROR_HITCH_CLOSE_TIMEOUT

Description: Hitch didn't close within time limit

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Hitch did not close within time limit set by hitch_pin_open_close_max_time_ms

How to recover: Check why the hitch does not close. Also check why the sensor does not detect the pin.

814 ERROR_HITCH_TONGUE_NOT_DETECTED

Description: Hitch tongue should be detected but is not

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Tongue is not detected even when it should

How to recover: Check the tongue sensor.

815 ERROR_HITCH_PIN_OPENED

Description: Hitch pin opened even though it should stay closed

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Hitch is opened even when it should be closed

How to recover: Close the hitch. This error can be ignored with parameter hitch_ignore_pin_state_after_change

816 ERROR_HITCH_PIN_CLOSED

Description: Hitch pin closed even though it should stay open

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Hitch is closed even when it should be opened

How to recover: Open the hitch. This error can be ignored with parameter hitch_ignore_pin_state_after_change

817 ERROR_HITCH_ALREADY_CLOSED

Description: Hitch pin was already closed when trying to close it

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with hitch

Error reason: Error not used anymore

How to recover:

818 ERROR_CAN_CONFIG_SYNC

Description: CAN error - no rx sync objects defined

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: System configuration error, no receive synchronization objects defined.

How to recover: Try setting parameter can_sync_rx_mode to value 0 and restart. If that does not help, then take a log (startlog.txt) and contact Navitec.

819 ERROR_PLC

Description: PLC Error received

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason:

How to recover:

820 ERROR_CAN_CONFIG_PARAM

Description: CAN configuration parameter failure

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason:

How to recover:

821 ERROR_NO_SUPERVISOR_COMMS

Description: No communication to Supervisor

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet control

Error reason:

How to recover:

822 ERROR_ETHERNET_FEEDBACK_DATA_ISNAN

Description: Vehicle control over Ethernet interface. Feedback data defined as float values are converted to nan or inf.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet control

Error reason: Data is not correctly converted in the PLC.

How to recover: Reprogramming the conversion.

823 ERROR_ETHERNET_FEEDBACK_EXCEEDING_LIMIT

Description: Vehicle control over Ethernet interface. Feedback data exceeds the speed or angle limits set in the parameters with more than 20%.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet control

Error reason: The speed measurement is not correctly scaled or the vehicle drives faster than the reference.

How to recover: Rescale the measurement or limit the control in the vehicle.

824 ERROR_CAN_SDO_FILE

Description: CAN SDO write configuration file sdo_write.txt failure.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet control

Error reason: One/some of the configured SDO operations are not according to syntax or value is out of bounds (below minimum or above maximum value).

How to recover: Check the content of file sdo_write.txt. If you are unsure which line causes the problem, you can comment out lines by simply adding '#' in start of the line.

825 ERROR_IMU_FAILURE

Description: IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) error or no connection

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: No IMU data - IMU communication failed. Because IMU has been defined as the only source for heading changes (imu_dh_use).

How to recover: If value of parameter imu_dh_use is right, then check the IMU connection and related parameters (imu_type, imu_serial_port, imu_id).

826 ERROR_CAN_HIGH_DT

Description: Vehicle interface to CAN update interval is too high.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with CAN interface

Error reason: Navitrol internal sync issue or CPU overload.

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec.

827 ERROR_STOPPED_BY_ULTRASONIC_SENSORS

Description: An error is displayed, if AGV is stopped, because of ultrasonic sensors are reporting that something is too close to the AGV.

Error level: Warning

Machine types: All vehicles using ultrasonic sensors, that are communicating with Navitrol

Error reason: AGV stopped by ultrasonic sensors

How to recover: If ultrasonic sensors are reporting false positive, they might need to be physically adjusted. Navitrol array parameters uss_sensor_zone1_dist_slow and uss_sensor_zone1_dist_fast decide, what is the maximum distance to trigger the slowdown. Ask Navitec for more details, if necessary.

828 ERROR_EXTERNAL_TARGET_DETECTION_SENSOR

Description: An error is displayed, if AGV is stopped, because external target detection scanner is in error state

Error level: Error

Machine types: All vehicles using External target detection sensor, that are communicating with Navitrol with Supervisor interface

Error reason: External target detection sensor is sending an error to Navitrol

How to recover: Supervisor is sending the error message to Navitrol. Check what is wrong with the external target detection sensor or why Supervisor is sending this error message to Navitrol

829 ERROR_SUPERVISOR_FEEDBACK_INVALID

Description: Vehicle control over Ethernet interface. Feedback data is invalid, reason being

  • Message number sequencing fails
  • float values nan or inf

Exact reason can be found from Navitrol log.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Supervisor control

Error reason: Data is not correctly built and transmitted in the PLC.

How to recover: Reprogramming the message build or socket handling.

830 ERROR_GPS_NO_CONNECTION

Description: There is no connection to the GPS receiver.

Error level: Error

Machine types: All

Error reason: No data is received from the receiver.

How to recover: Check the power supply of the receiver, check the connection cable. Check if the web interface of the receiver is accessible.

832 ERROR_ETHERNET_CONTROL_MESSAGE_TIMEOUT

Description: Ethernet control message timeout, Navitrol does not receive the required control data in time.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles with Ethernet control

Error reason: No ethernet control message has been received for 500 ms.

How to recover: Send control messages to Navitrol regularly with a message interval less than 500 ms.

833 ERROR_ACTUATOR_UPDATE_MEASUREMENT_TIMEOUT

Description: Ethernet actuator control message timeout, Navitrol does not receive the required control data in time.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Vehicles where Navitrol controls the actuator and the control data is passed via message 1030 (protocol version 4).

Error reason: No actuator control message has been received for 2000 ms.

How to recover: Send actuator control data via message 1030 to Navitrol regularly with a message interval less than 2000 ms.

835 ERROR_ROS_NO_CONNECTION

Description: Navitrol has lost/no connection with ROS by not receiving any messages from ROS for a short period of time.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with ROS.

Error reason: Navitrol has not received any messages from ROS for 500 ms. (Note: This is not dependent on whether there is any message traffic in ROS's internal network or not.)

How to recover:

  • Check that ROS Docker container ros_obstacle_avoidance is running (by command docker ps -a)
  • More information: Obstacle avoidance V2

Advanced information:

  • The following ROS - Navitrol connection parameters are not required to be set. If they are set, they should be:
    • S, ros_ip, 0.0.0.0
    • I, ros_port_in, 13579
    • I, ros_port_out, 24680
    • S, nav_ipc_ip, 0.0.0.0

836 ERROR_OBST_AV_V2_NO_PATH

See feature documentation for Obstacle avoidance V2

837 ERROR_OBSTACLE_AVOIDANCE_V2_COMMUNICATION_TIMEOUT

See feature documentation for Obstacle avoidance V2

839 ERROR_ABS_POS_NO_MEAS_RECEIVED

Description: Navitrol has not received any valid absolute positioning measurement in a time interval of parameter sf_abspos_max_time_since_valid_meas_ms_arr[].

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with ROS.

Error reason: Navitrol has not received any valid absolute positioning measurement in a time interval of parameter sf_abspos_max_time_since_valid_meas_ms_arr[].

How to recover:

  • Check that Navitec ROS Docker container is running (docker ps -a)
  • Check that GIM ROS Docker containers are running (docker ps -a)
  • Check the 'Absolute positioning' document for
    • Advanced troubleshooting
    • Required parameters for ROS and sensor fusion

840 ERROR_ETHERCAT_NO_COMMS

Description: Navitrol has no connection to EtherCAT/EtherCAT slaves or no valid data has been received for 100 ms.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with EtherCAT.

Error reason: Navitrol has not been able to intialize/configure EtherCAT properly or slaves at run time are not working as expected.

How to recover:

  • Check that EtherCAT parameters (ethercat_mode, ethercat_inte_primary, ethercat_inte_redundant) are defined correctly in Navitrol's params.txt
  • Check that EtherCAT is connected to defined interface(s)
  • Check that all EtherCAT HW and slaves are properly connected and powered

842 ERROR_CONFIG_GENERIC

Description: Generic error during configuration.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle.

Error reason: Configuration failed. Check the log for more details.

How to recover: Check the log for more details. Contact Navitec support.

843 ERROR_ETHERCAT_CONFIG

Description: Error during Ethercat slave configuration.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with EtherCAT.

Error reason: Ethercat slave configuration failed. Check that Ethercat HW and slaves are properly connected and powered.

How to recover: Check the log for more details. Contact Navitec support.

844 ERROR_ETHERCAT_HIGH_DT

Description: Update interval from vehicle interface to EtherCAT is too high.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with EtherCAT.

Error reason: Vehicle interface is not responding to EtherCAT.

How to recover: In most cases, this error is caused by some other Ethercat error or issue with initialization of AGV. Might be caused by CPU overload. Check the log or console for more details. Contact Navitec support.

845 ERROR_CONFLICTING_FEEDBACK_SENSOR_TYPE

Description: Feedback sensor type defined by parameters conflicts with the one coming from the controller.

Error level: Fatal Error

Machine types: Any vehicle communicating with Roboteq motor controller via CAN bus.

Error reason: Wrong or missing script in Roboteq controller.

How to recover: Check that Roboteq script is latest available. If problem is not solved, take a log and contact Navitec.

846 ERROR_ENCODER_MODEL_INVALID

Description: Encoder model is not valid

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicles.

Error reason: Encoder model is not properly defined in parameters or in the software.

How to recover: Check encoder model parameters. Contact Navitec support.

847 ERROR_ETHERCAT_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND

Description: At least one EtherCAT slave device is not found on the bus

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicles.

Error reason: Some of the devices expected by Navitrol are missing from the bus.

How to recover: Check the log or terminal for more details. Check that all devices are powered and connected to the bus. Check Navitrol parameters. Contact Navitec support.

848 ERROR_ENCODER_CONFIG

Description: Invalid encoder configuration. Check encoder parameters

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any vehicles.

Error reason: Some of the encoder parameter is not valid.

How to recover: Check the log or terminal for more details. Check Navitrol parameters. Contact Navitec support.

849 ERROR_NO_PROFINET_COMMS

Description: No communication to Profinet Supervisor

Error level: Error

Machine types: AGVs that are controlled over Profinet interface

Error reason: Profinet interface has been enabled but the communication between Navitrol and (PLC) Supervisor is not operational.

How to recover:

  • Check that Profinet Supervisor is running and trying to connect to Navitrol
  • Check that the ethernet cables are connected
  • Check port and IP address parameters with "profinet_"-prefix from params.txt
  • Reboot AGV

850 ERROR_PROFINET_CONFIG

Description: Profinet slave configuration failure.

Error level: Fatal Error

Machine types: Any

Error reason: Profinet interface has not been configured correctly.

How to recover: Check Navitrol parameters with "profinet_"-prefix and restart Navitrol. If the problem remains take a log an contact Navitec support.

853 ERROR_3D_POSITIONING_MAP_MISMATCH

Description: There is a map mismatch between Navitrol's map and the 3d positioning map.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any

Error reason: A 3d positioning map corresponding to the unique id from the environment file could not be found.

How to recover: Upload the correct 3d positioning map.

854 ERROR_3D_POSITION_NOT_INITIALIZED

Description: 3D position has not been initialized.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any

Error reason: A valid 3D position has not been yet found (due to a bad or missing pose input).

How to recover: Give an initial pose input e.g. from Navitrol Monitor. If error ROS_NO_CONNECTION is active, resolve that error first.

855 ERROR_3D_POSITIONING

Description: The 3D positioning software is having an active error. Automatic driving is disabled.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Any

Error reason: The 3D positioning software is having an active error.

How to recover: A device error will occur, providing a more detailed error explanation. If the issue persists, take a log and contact Navitec.

858 ERROR_SIMOVE_NAV_NO_COMMS

Description: No communication to SIMOVE navigation interface.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Machines using SIMOVE interface

Error reason: No data has been received from SIMOVE navigation interface within a time limit.

How to recover: Verify that SIMOVE connection parameters are correct (ip, port). Restart Navitrol after modifying connection parameters.

859 ERROR_SIMOVE_CTRL_NO_COMMS

Description: No communication to SIMOVE controller interface.

Error level: Error

Machine types: Machines using SIMOVE interface

Error reason: No data has been received from SIMOVE controller interface within a time limit.

How to recover: Verify that SIMOVE connection parameters are correct (ip, port). Restart Navitrol after modifying connection parameters.

860 ERROR_EXTERNAL_TARGET_DETECTION_NO_DETECTION

Description: External target detection didn't detect target within specified time.

Error Level: Fatal error

Machine types: All vehicles

Error reason: Navitrol didn't receive target detected message from external target detection within ext_target_det_response_timeout_ms time. This error is used only in event based mode where Navitrol expects only one response after it has requested the detection.

How to recover: The external target detection device has to be checked why it didn't response within time. If it is just too slow, this ext_target_det_response_timeout_ms parameter can be increased. Acknowledge when fatal error can be cleared.

861 ERROR_SIMOVE_ACTION_FAILED

Description: Action failure reported by SIMOVE controller

Error level: Fatal error

Machine types: Machines using SIMOVE interface

Error reason: Action has finished in FAILED state and can't recover automatically

How to recover: Find the reason for the failed action and verify that AGV is in safe state to continue. Fatal errors must be acknowledged by the user.

Hardware/Machine Specific Warnings

901 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_ENC_FILE_FAIL

Description: Lift height encoder configuration file parsing failed

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: enc_data.txt file cound not be read in

How to recover: Check that the file exist and is valid

902 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_CFG_FAILED

Description: Lift motor controller configuration failure

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Could not configure the lift controller

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec

903 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_CALIB_FAILED

Description: Lift height measurement calibration failure

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Could not calibrate the lift controller

How to recover: Try to calibrate again. If it fails take a log and contact Navitec.

904 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_MOVE_TIMEOUT

Description: Lift movement timeout

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Lift did not reach the target in time

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec

905 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_CALIB_NOTDONE

Description: Lift height measurement not calibrated

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Lift is not calibrated

How to recover: Calibrate the lift. If there are problems take a log and contact Navitec

906 WARNING_LIFT_CTRL_DISABLED

Description: Lift height control disabled

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with lift

Error reason: Error not used anymore

How to recover:

907 WARNING_UI_NOT_CONNECTED

Description: No connection to UI

Error level: Warning

Machine types: Vehicles with touch screen user interface from Navitec

Error reason: UI software may not be started

How to recover: Take a log and contact Navitec

908 WARNING_PLC_SAFETY_SCANNER_STOP

Description: Safety scanner stop on PLC

Error level: Warning
